<summary>
    • The paper presents numerical methods for solving two-dimensional convection-diffusion equations with both Dirichlet and Neumann boundary conditions using modified cubic B-splines differential quadrature method (DQM).
        • The methods transform the convection-diffusion equation into a system of first-order ordinary differential equations (ODEs) in time.
            • The ODEs are solved using the SSP-RK54 time integration scheme.
            • The stability of the methods is analyzed using matrix stability analysis.
            • The methods are found to be stable for the convection-diffusion equation.
            • The numerical results are compared with existing schemes and exact solutions.
            • The proposed methods are more accurate and have a good agreement with exact solutions.
            • The order of accuracy for the convection-diffusion problem with Dirichlet boundary conditions is cubic, while it is quadratic for Neumann boundary conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
* Combined submm and mm maps of the lockman hole region
    * Resulting in a catalogue several times larger than individual maps
    * Free from spurious or artificially bright sources
    * Expected to detect a significant fraction of smgs in well-matched radio imaging
    * Provides a route to identify the true far - ir-luminous source within crowded fields
* Spectroscopic redshifts of 15 smgs
    * Median redshift of @xmath0
    * Ten considered secure
    * Consistent with the redshift distribution determined by c05
    * Supports the conclusions of c05
* Radio detections and spectroscopy suggest
    * Bright smgs are not likely at very high redshift
    * Amenable to study via radio-selected samples down to a flux density limit of @xmath1
</summary>

* * The normalization of the local luminosity function ( LF) derived from the Norris survey of the Corona Borealis supercluster is approximately 1.6 times higher than that of the Stromlo/APM survey.
    * The mean color of the local galaxies in the Norris survey is that of an SB galaxy, whereas the mean color of LCRS galaxies is that of an E galaxy.
* * The LF of the field galaxies shows evolution with redshift, with the population of blue, star-forming galaxies becoming more luminous and the median color of the field galaxy population not changing.
    * The fraction of galaxies with [OII] emission and hα absorption increases with redshift, suggesting ongoing star formation in the population of blue galaxies.

<summary>
* The unitarity of the @xmath0-channel two - gluon exchange amplitude in color - singlet exchange processes is violated in the two - gluon exchange model.
* Unitarization of the amplitude leads to a more realistic description with significant deviations from the two - gluon exchange model predictions.
* The color singlet exchange fraction is strongly dependent on the regularization procedure and cannot be reliably calculated within perturbation theory.
* A unified phenomenological description of rapidity gap data can be achieved using a universal phase and the gap survival probability.
* The formation of rapidity gaps in hadronic scattering events requires a non - perturbative understanding of the hard color singlet exchange process.
</summary>

<summary>
* Artificial Neural Network (ANN) approach to forecast electric energy consumption in Gaza Strip
  * * Historical data from 1994 to 2013 was used to develop the forecast model
    * Training and learning procedures are fundamental in forecasting future events
      * Selection of inputs for ANN training is vital for successful training
      * Network processes input and compares output with desired result, adjusting weights for error minimization
      * ANN can predict future trends with poor but rich datasets
* Performance of the ANN model was evaluated using error criteria
    * Mean Squared Error (MSE), Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE), Mean Absolute Error (MAE), and Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE)
      * ANN model showed good accuracy in forecasting energy consumption for 2012 and 2013
* The ANN model was simulated to predict energy consumption for 2012 and 2013
    * Results indicated the relevance of the proposed ANN approach in forecasting electric energy consumption
      * Error criteria were within tolerable bounds
* This study presents the first ANN model to forecast electric energy consumption in Gaza Strip
      * Future works will consider other forecasting techniques
</summary>

<summary>
    • Researchers apply a new technique to detect the donor star in the persistent low-mass X-ray binary (lmxb) lmcx-2.
    • They detect narrow emission lines in the bowen region, tentatively identifying them as originating from the irradiated side of the donor star.
    • This allows for the first time constraints on the system parameters of lmcx-2, suggesting a massive neutron star as the compact object.

    • The orbital period of lmcx-2 is determined to be close to the previously published photometric period of 8.15 hours.
    • The 12-day period detected by crampton et al. (1990) is interpreted as the super-orbital period due to an inclined precessing accretion disk.
    • The radial velocity curve of the heii @xmath14686 emission line shows periodic variability, interpreted as the orbital period.
    • The heii emission line also changes in strength, suggesting a long-term variation possibly related to the precession of the accretion disk.
    • Doppler tomography of the most prominent emission lines reveals a ring-like structure in the accretion disk, with minor differences between the two nights of observations.
    • The bright spot in the heii doppler maps is interpreted as an irradiated region on the surface of the donor star, but its phasing differs from the primary's orbital phasing.
    • The system parameters of lmcx-2 are constrained within a large range, but the presence of a precessing accretion disk and narrow emission lines from the donor star suggest a more massive neutron star.
    • A long-term spectroscopic campaign could further constrain the system parameters and potentially identify the nature of the donor star.
</summary>

* The axial anomaly can be related to polarized radiative decays, such as the radiative pion and @xmath1 decays.
    * The axial anomaly manifests itself in helicity changing processes, where a fermion changes helicity by emitting a photon.
        * The axial anomaly is connected to the non-conservation of helicity in the chiral limit.
            * The cancellation of mass singularities in these processes is different from the usual one, controlled by the axial anomaly.
                * The collinear limit results disconnected from the infrared one, due to the constraints imposed by the helicity flip in the photon-lepton vertex.
                    * The axial anomaly implies that the collinear limit gives a finite result, independent of the fermion mass.

* The paper presents a novel approach to salient object detection in complex scenes by separating the detection and segmentation steps.
    * * The authors propose a simple, computationally efficient model that outperforms state-of-the-art methods on new benchmark datasets.
        * * The model uses fixation prediction to identify potential salient regions and then applies a superpixel-based segmentation to isolate the most salient object.
        * * The paper also introduces two new datasets, bruce-a and judd-a, which address biases in existing datasets and provide a more comprehensive evaluation of salient object detection models.
            * * The datasets include eye-tracking data, object annotations, and explicit saliency judgments, allowing for a more accurate assessment of model performance.
            * * The paper highlights the importance of considering both appearance and boundary cues for salient object detection and suggests future research directions in this area.

<summary>
    • The paper aims to provide a combinatorial method for calculating the ranks of maps in a decorated topological quantum field theory (tqft) associated with cobordisms between certain 4-manifolds.
    • The authors focus on cobordisms that induce surjective maps on heegaard floer homology groups, specifically those obtained from two-handle additions.
    • They introduce the concept of a "nice" triple heegaard diagram, where all unpunctured elementary domains are either bigons, triangles, or rectangles.
    • The authors describe a process to construct a nice triple heegaard diagram for a given cobordism, involving modifications to the original diagram and the addition of specific curves.
    • They demonstrate that in a nice diagram, holomorphic triangles can be counted combinatorially, providing a combinatorial description of the map on heegaard floer homology groups.
</summary>

* * the paper extends classical results of Gerstenhaber and Schack on the infinitesimal deformation theory of associative algebras to a deformation theory for arbitrary pasting diagrams of @xmath0-linear categories, @xmath0-linear functors, and natural transformations .
    * the authors establish that obstructions to deformations are cocycles for deformation complexes of pasting diagrams in general , by applying a method developed by Shrestha .
    * they describe chain maps induced by pasting compositions on the full deformation complexes , and provide explicit examples of deformation complexes associated to various commutative pasting diagrams .
    * they also clarify a point overlooked in the statements and proofs of theorems 8.2 and 8.3 in the referenced work : the cochain maps constructed in those theorems depend on choices of association for 2-dimensional compositions in the pasting diagram , but are independent of those choices , up to algebraic homotopy .

<summary>
• The aim in physics is to understand the physical picture behind observable phenomena, not just calculate them.
    • Theories can become overly complicated at certain scales, necessitating the selection of essential degrees of freedom.
    • In crystals, essential degrees of freedom include "heavy electrons" and phonons, hiding complex electromagnetic interactions.
    • In QCD, spontaneous chiral symmetry breaking (SSB) is crucial for understanding nucleon and baryon properties.
    • SSB leads to the appearance of pseudoscalar mesons and the acquisition of dynamical mass by quarks, termed "constituent quarks."
    • The chiral symmetry breaking in QCD is evidenced by nonzero quark condensates and has two generic consequences: the formation of pseudoscalar mesons and the generation of constituent quark mass.
    • The chiral constituent quark model provides a unified description of baryon spectra, explaining the ordering of states and the presence of small splittings.
    • The model predicts a short-range repulsion in the nucleon-nucleon interaction, attributed to the short-range part of chiral symmetry breaking.
    • The same short-range repulsion is expected in other octet and decuplet systems, but with varying strengths due to explicit chiral symmetry breaking.
    • The nucleon consists of overlapping constituent quarks, with short-range interactions dominating due to meson clouds.
    • The model suggests that the short-range repulsion in the nucleon-nucleon system is related to the fermi nature of constituent quarks and specific quark interactions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to novel calcium phosphate-coated implantable medical devices that minimize immune response and can store and release medication in a controlled manner.
  • The devices are particularly useful for cardiovascular stents, which are prone to inflammatory restenosis post-implantation.
  • Traditional polymer coatings on stents are not always effective long-term and can lead to adverse tissue responses.
  • Calcium phosphate materials, such as hydroxyapatite, are biocompatible and bio-resorbable, making them ideal for coating implantable devices.
  • The invention includes a sol-gel process for synthesizing calcium phosphate coatings at low temperatures, avoiding substrate degradation and allowing for controlled porosity and drug release.
  • The process allows for the creation of both continuous and discontinuous calcium phosphate coatings with high bonding strength and flexibility.
  • The coatings can be applied using various techniques, including dip-coating, spin-coating, and electro-phoretic deposition.
  • The invention offers advantages over other processes, such as shorter processing times, low-temperature calcination, and the ability to create porous coatings for drug impregnation.
</summary>

<summary>
• Cross-reference to related U.S. Provisional Patent Application No. 61/838,553
    • Statement regarding federally-sponsored research
    • Field of invention: nerve regeneration, specifically nerve conduits for peripheral nerve regeneration
    • Background: limitations of current nerve repair methods and potential of NGCs
    • Summary of invention: fabricated implantable NGC with spiral structured porous sheet and integrated surface channels
    • Detailed description: NGCs with improved mechanical strength, multiple channels, aligned fibers, and tunable features
    • Exemplary fabrication method: spiral NGC with outer fibrous tube and aligned nanofibers
    • Tensile properties: Young's Modulus, percent elongation to failure, and tensile strength
    • Porosities: measured for different NGC types
    • Cell proliferation: greater in NGCs with aligned nanofibers
    • Implantation of NGCs: evaluation of nerve regeneration in rats
    • Functional recovery: compound muscle action potentials and nerve conduction velocities
    • Muscle reinnervation: muscle weight ratio, fiber diameter, and fiber coverage
    • Conclusion: spiral NGCs with surface channels and aligned fibers show potential for nerve regeneration and muscle reinnervation
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to seat base support assemblies, particularly non-coil spring types like sinuous band seat springs, wire grids, chord-rubber webbing, or flexible steel bands.
    * It addresses the need for increased upward resilience in seat base support assemblies due to the trend towards thicker cushions and lower seat frame heights.
    * The invention introduces two related forms of rail connectors for these assemblies.
    * The first form uses a pre-stressed, close wound coil spring with attachment arms that can be wound on an axis transverse or longitudinal to the spring band.
    * The second form uses a pre-stressed, cantilever spring configuration suitable for sinuous spring bands with leverage-amplified torsioning.
    * Both forms of connectors combine essential seat-force-generators: torsioning, dynamic uplift, expansion-contraction, and leverage-amplification.
    * They provide desired seat-performance characteristics such as initial-drop, deep-drop, softness without bottoming, and resilient uplift proportionate to load.
    * The connectors can be used with various forms of seat base support means, not just sinuous spring bands, to provide dynamic uplift.
* The invention is a significant advancement in furniture seat spring technology, offering improved comfort and performance by enhancing the dynamic uplift and resilience of seat base support assemblies.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The disclosure relates to a crush-resistant anvil assembly for a circular surgical stapling device.
        • The anvil assembly includes an anvil shaft with flexible legs defining a longitudinal bore and an anvil head assembly supporting a staple deforming plate.
        • A stabilizing collet within the bore supports the flexible legs and prevents damage during coupling to the stapling device's trocar.
        • The collet may be cylindrical, substantially rigid, and have cantilevered fingers to secure it within the bore.
        • The anvil shaft defines holes to receive the collet's protrusions, and the anvil head assembly can be pivotally or fixedly attached to the shaft.
        • The anvil assembly facilitates reliable attachment of the anvil assembly to the stapling device, especially during endoscopic surgical procedures.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a blender container with high-speed blades and a protective lining to improve hygiene and efficiency.
    • The lining is formed as a shield inside the blender cup, with teeth projecting from it to grind fibers.
    • The lining can be made of metal, glass, alloy, or non-alloy material, with a hardness more rigid than the cup.
    • The lining is shaped as a half-mask or whole mask, with vertical ribs and stopper members to guide fibers into the teeth for grinding.
    • The lining is integrated with the cup, either as a single piece or from multiple pieces, with a lip or horizontal ring for user convenience.
    • The invention aims to reduce grating time, prevent oxidization, and preserve nutrition and color of the juice.
    • The invention includes four embodiments with variations in the lining shape and integration method.
    • The lining shields the inner wall from collisions, while the teeth grate and chop fibers, reducing stirring time and oxidization.
    • The invention provides a hygienic and efficient solution to the problems of previous blender containers.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a garnish pick with multiple appendages for holding and securing garnishes in beverages.
    * The garnish pick may have a main shaft with one or more appendages projecting at various angles to simulate organic forms or to serve as hooks and skewering shafts.
    * The garnish pick can prevent the pick from sliding into the beverage, making it easier to remove and eat the garnishes without using fingers.
    * The garnish pick can be made from various materials and may have different cross-sectional shapes, including curved or twisted appendages.
* The invention claims priority to and is a continuation of a previous U.S. patent application titled GARNISH PICK, filed in 2010.
    * The invention includes various embodiments of garnish picks with different configurations of appendages, hooks, and skewering shafts.
    * The invention also includes various construction details and material options for the garnish picks.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a cardiac assist system that combines a cardiomyostimulator and a cardiac pacer-cardioverter-defibrillator.
        • It aims to provide rapid detection and response to cardiac arrhythmias while delivering muscle-powered cardiac assistance.
            • The system temporarily inhibits skeletal muscle stimulation upon arrhythmia detection to avoid interference with arrhythmia detection.
            • It features programmable detection interval ranges for identifying normal sinus rhythm, tachyarrhythmias, and fibrillation.
            • The device delivers various therapies based on the type and severity of detected arrhythmias, including VT and VF therapies.
            • It includes a mechanism for synchronizing defibrillation pulses with cardiac events and re-enabling muscle stimulation post-defibrillation.
            • The invention allows for muscle stimulation during defibrillation charging, which helps maintain cardiac output and defibrillation thresholds.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an accommodating intraocular lens device for implantation in the eye, addressing the need for treating both ophthalmic cataracts and presbyopia.
    • The device comprises two lens portions: a deformable lens chamber for accommodation and a base lens for refractive power.
    • The deformable lens chamber is made of an elastically deformable material and has a gradient thickness profile to encourage deformation without buckling.
    • The base lens is more rigid and does not deform under radially compressive forces, transferring these forces to the deformable chamber.
    • The device may include a gel or fluid in the cavity to enhance accommodation range, with a refractive index of at least 1.46 and a Young's modulus of 10 psi or less.
    • The lens chamber and base lens are coupled by a periphery, which may have features like hinges or apertures for fluid communication.
    • The device is designed to be implanted in a capsular bag of the eye, with a delivery profile that can be smaller than the incision size.
    • The invention aims to provide a range of accommodation up to at least 3 diopters, preferably up to 15 diopters, by changing the curvature of the lens chamber in response to accommodative forces.
    • The invention includes various embodiments with different materials, designs, and features to optimize the range of accommodation and refractive power.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to esophageal electrodes for heart procedures, aiming to position the electrode closer to the heart for efficiency.
    • The electrode comprises a semi-rigid plastic tube with a distal electrode, inserted orally or nasally.
    • The tube has a hinge and a control mechanism for bending the distal end.
    • A rigid pin within the tube, connected to cords, allows the distal end to bend and press against the esophagus or stomach wall.
    • The electrode can be positioned in the stomach wall to be closer to the heart, reducing energy needed for pacing or defibrillation.
    • The control mechanism enables the user to manipulate the electrode's position noninvasively.
    • The invention can be modified without departing from its essence, and its scope is defined by the claims.
• The electrode is made of suitable material like nylon, approximately 20 inches long, and 3/16 inch in diameter.
    • The distal end carries a spherical electrode with a stem that fits within the tube.
    • The electrode is pressed in place or fastened by other means.
    • The tube is crimped to form a hinge, with ports on either side of the hinge for cord entry and exit.
    • A rigid pin extends parallel to the tube, preventing bending at the crimped area and limiting travel when the pin reaches a lower port.
    • The control mechanism, connected to the cords, operates the displacement mechanism by moving a slide that adjusts the pin's position.
• The control mechanism includes a sleeve with a U-shaped slide that moves the pin to the distal end of the tube.
    • The slide is connected to flanges on the cords, and its movement adjusts the pin's position within the tube.
    • Moving the slide to the right deflects the tube and positions the electrode closer to the heart.
    • The tube returns to its original position when the slide is moved back, allowing the electrode to be withdrawn.
• The invention enhances procedures like ventricular pacing

<summary>
    • The invention is a board game with a lake theme that simulates the ups and downs of life at a lake.
        • The game includes a playing board, tokens representing player identities, title deed cards, game pieces, scrip money, and cards with penalties, awards, and directions.
        • Players acquire lake properties, dams, and boat dealerships, and can improve them by erecting cabins and marinas.
        • The game involves random movement of tokens, purchasing and selling properties, and managing rental payments and financial obligations.
        • Players can experience financial success or failure, with the game ending when all but one player is bankrupt.
        • The game includes illustrations and designs related to lake life, and can be played with two to nine players.
        • The game can be played with scrip money in denominations of $1, $5, $10, $20, $50, $100, and $500, with a preferred starting amount of $1,500 per player.
        • The game includes various spaces with specific functions, such as GO space, lake areas, boat dealerships, dams, and penalty/award spaces.
        • The game can be played with dice or any other chance-determining element for token movement.
        • The game includes various cards with lake-related themes, such as Makin A Wake and Sunken Chest cards, with benefits, penalties, and instructions.
        • The game can be played with a predetermined amount of lake cabins and marinas for placement upon lake areas.
        • The game can be played with a Banker who handles scrip transactions.
        • The game can be played with a predetermined number of players, with a preferred number of four to nine.
        • The game can be played with a continuous path on the board, with players collecting $200 for completing a circuit.
        • The game can be played with a variety of game pieces representing different lake-related activities.
        • The game can be played with a variety of title deed cards associated with lake areas, boat dealerships, and dams.
        • The game can be played with a variety of cards with lake

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device and method for treating and regenerating tissues, covering wounds, by combining fluid supply and suction.
  * The device includes a movable rest on a pole, a fluid reservoir, and means for controlling fluid supply and suction.
  * The rest can be positioned at various angles and heights, with a level meter used for height adjustment.
  * The fluid reservoir comprises a pliable bag filled with treatment fluid, connected to the tissue by a tube.
  * The controlling means can include a drip chamber, a roller clamp, a level meter, and an injection port.
  * The apparatus can also include a motor for automatic movement, ultrasound level meters, a pump for fluid supply, and a scale for monitoring fluid volume.
  * The suction means can be connected to a canister with a scale for weight measurement.
  * The apparatus can further comprise a method for treating and regenerating tissues by administering restricted fluid to the dressing pad during suctioning, and a method for detecting bleeding from a wound during suctioning.
* The invention also includes a drainage port with an open grid to prevent occlusion of the dressing pad's pores during suctioning.
  * The grid can be made of interconnected or separate units with open pores or spatia.
  * The grid covers the underside of the drainage port abutting the dressing pad.
  * The grid can include an opening in the flange to allow access to the port.
* The invention provides a method for treating and regenerating tissues by eliminating hydrostatic pressure in the fluid supply port and maintaining tissue hydrostatic pressure at the supply port at 0 mmHg.
  * The fluid flow is maintained in a range between 100 ml/24/h and 2,400 ml/24/h, with loading doses in the range between 1 ml and 500 ml.
  * The suction is maintained in a range between −20 mmHg and −200 mmHg, maximally −760 mmHg.
  * The method can

<summary>
* The invention relates to a gravity-driven, steerable vehicle that can be ridden in a prone, face-down, face-forward position and is equipped with at least two wheels or skis, or a combination of both.
  * The vehicle is designed to provide precise control in turns, especially on snow, through a specialized suspension mechanism.
  * The invention includes a retrofit kit for converting a wheeled vehicle to a ski-equipped version for use on snow.
  * The vehicle features a low center of gravity for stability and control, and a safety harness for rider security.
  * The vehicle's steering and braking systems are designed for responsiveness and ease of use.
  * The vehicle can be equipped with a combination of wheels, skis, or slide pans for enhanced performance on varied terrain.
  * The vehicle's suspension system is designed to absorb shock and provide precise control during turns.
  * The vehicle can be retrofitted with a tow-bar assembly for lifting and towing.
  * The vehicle's body and chassis are made from lightweight, impact-resistant materials for durability and protection.
  * The vehicle's steering system is based on a bicycle-style design for familiarity and ease of use.
  * The vehicle's braking system can be hydraulic, mechanical, or a combination of both, and can be applied to all wheels or some wheels.
  * The vehicle's suspension system can be independently configured for each wheel or ski, or for the entire vehicle.
  * The vehicle's body design is monocoque, eliminating the need for separate frames and bodies.
  * The vehicle's brake assembly provides superior braking action in snow and ice conditions.
  * The vehicle's ski assembly can be equipped with a braking assembly that engages the terrain surface upon which the ski is running.
  * The vehicle's design allows for the use of studded tires for improved traction on ice-covered surfaces.
  * The vehicle's suspension system can be configured with a double arm design for improved handling and control.
  * The vehicle's body and frame are designed to accommodate various materials and adapt to

<summary>
* The invention relates to a wave-based imaging method and apparatus that employs inverse wave techniques for reconstructing images of objects surrounding a physical probe in a plane perpendicular to its axis of rotation, using radial reflection diffraction tomography (RRDT).
* The method includes directing predetermined energy waves radially outward from within an interspace and receiving scattered energy waves, which are processed using a wave-based algorithm to construct images of the objects.
* The invention also includes a wave-based imaging apparatus with a flexible substrate and one or more elements capable of directing energy waves and receiving scattered energy waves, which are processed to produce images of the objects.
* The Hilbert space inverse wave (HSIW) algorithm is used to map angular location and frequency parameters of received scattered energy waves to characterize plaque within a living vessel.
* The invention can be utilized for non-destructive characterization of buried wastes, tracking underground contaminants, and evaluating parts with existing access holes.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a biological oil composition derived from marine copepods, particularly Calanus finmarchicus, with a unique chemical composition rich in wax esters, SDA, EPA, and DHA.
        • The oil composition exhibits anti-atherosclerotic properties, significantly inhibiting plaque formation in mice, unlike concentrated EPA/DHA.
        • It also effectively lowers total blood cholesterol levels, differing from the effects of EPA/DHA.
        • The oil composition can be used in dietary supplements, functional foods, and pharmaceutical products for cardiovascular disease prevention and treatment.
        • The oil is a low-viscous liquid at room temperature, and its composition can be adjusted to contain specific percentages of wax esters, SDA, EPA, and DHA.
        • The invention also includes methods for administering the oil composition for cardiovascular disease prophylaxis or treatment.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to pharmacological compositions containing polyelectrolyte complexes and active substances, with properties suitable for diverse pharmaceutical applications.
  * The active substances can be embedded in the polyelectrolyte complex matrix, be a partner in the complex, or be bound to a complex partner.
  * The invention enables the preparation of microparticles with over 90% incorporation capacity of active substances, contrary to expectations for such complexes.
  * The microparticles can be prepared in the form of emulsions with controlled size distribution, suitable for various administration routes.
  * The polyelectrolyte complexes can be formed from biocompatible, biodegradable polyacids and polybases, with controlled release properties.
  * The invention includes methods for incorporating active substances into polyelectrolyte complexes through entrapment, absorption, chemical binding, or as a complex partner.
  * The invention demonstrates the use of polyelectrolyte complexes in vaccine formulations, wound ointments, and ultrasonic contrast agents.
  * The invention provides examples of polyelectrolyte complex formulations with controlled release profiles for various active substances, including cytostatics, antibiotics, and proteins.
  * The invention includes examples of vaccine formulations using polyelectrolyte complex microparticles, showing enhanced immune response compared to traditional adjuvants.
  * The invention also includes examples of polyelectrolyte complex microparticles as ultrasonic contrast agents, with particles capable of passing through capillaries without hindrance.
  * The invention provides examples of release tests for active substances from polyelectrolyte complex microparticles, demonstrating controlled release profiles.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention presents a golf ball teeing device that eliminates the need for manual unclamping and allows for easy teeing without bending over.
    * The device can be attached to a golf club, making it lightweight and portable.
    * It is designed to be small and unobtrusive, not requiring much space in a golf bag.
    * The device can be quickly and easily used without cumbersome controls, and it can also retrieve the tee after the ball has been hit.
* The invention features a housing with a top and bottom wall, side walls with recesses, and a slot for the golf tee.
    * A delayed urging means is used to secure the ball and tee, which compresses upon insertion and slowly rebounds.
    * The device includes gripping fingers and a clip for attachment to a golf bag or clothing, and it is made from flexible, impact-resistant material.
* The device operates by compressing the delayed urging means when the tee is inserted into the ground, and it can be retrieved by moving the golf club vertically.
    * The device can be used to retrieve the tee whether it remains in the ground or comes out horizontally after hitting the ball.
* The invention aims to address the disadvantages of prior art devices, such as weight, size, complexity, and the need for a long handle with an unclamping control.
    * It offers a simple, efficient solution for golfers with mobility issues and enhances the overall golfing experience.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present disclosure relates to a person support apparatus, such as a hospital or LTC bed, with a mechanism for adjusting the height and orientation of the patient support frame.
    * The apparatus includes a person support frame with two sides (head and foot ends) and a support assembly with leg assemblies pivotally coupled to the frame and connected to floor engaging means.
    * The leg assemblies have guide or follower elements that run along an inner surface of a channel element within the frame, allowing for height adjustment and movement between horizontal, Trendelenburg, and reverse Trendelenburg positions.
    * The channel element has a U-shaped design with a continuous upper surface and side surfaces connected at the top, and a downward opening between the bottom edges.
    * The leg assembly works vertically within the channel edges, reducing the force necessary to lift the frame, especially from the low position.
    * The channel faces downwards, reducing the risk of dirt interference and making it harder for patients or caregivers to trap their fingers.
    * The apparatus may include a braking mechanism for the castors at the foot ends, allowing the bed to be locked in a lowered position.
    * The braking mechanism engages a brake lever connected to the channel element, which can be actuated by a caregiver to lock the castors in place.
    * The channel element can be positioned closer to the castor wheels, enabling direct engagement with the brake lever.
    * The disclosure includes various embodiments and features that can be combined to form patentable subject matter.
    * The disclosure builds upon and improves upon known arrangements for pivoting leg assemblies relative to a deck support frame.
    * The disclosure aims to provide a robust, stable, and cost-effective solution for adjusting patient support surfaces in hospital beds.
* The disclosure includes detailed drawings and descriptions of illustrative embodiments, including isometric and perspective views, side views, detailed sections, and diagrams of roller dimensions and channel elements.
    * The drawings and descriptions illustrate the design and functionality of the person support apparatus, including the deck support frame, leg assemblies, stabilizer elements, actuator-stabilizer yokes, and braking mechanisms.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a skin reflectance measuring apparatus.
    * Background: Measurement of skin reflectance is useful in pathology and cosmetology, particularly for studying skin diseases and the effectiveness of anti-reflectance products.
    * Problems with existing methods: Industrial methods are not suitable for skin reflectance due to color influence and the need for accurate positioning.
    * Objective: To propose a miniaturized, easy-to-handle apparatus for measuring skin reflectance.
    * Apparatus components:
        * A probe with an aperture and fiber optics connection.
        * A measuring device with light emitting and receiving means, processing means, and correcting means.
        * A display device for indicating reflectance amplitude.
    * Advantages:
        * Miniaturization allows measurements on small skin areas.
        * Flexible connection tolerates position deviations.
        * Correction for light variations and ambient light improves accuracy.
        * Digital processing aids in measurement control and result processing.
        * Immediate display assists probe positioning.
        * Relative reflectance value (difference or quotient) is preferred for less scale distortion.
        * Calibration is performed using a matt surface and a calibrated mirror.
        * The apparatus can be integrated into a computer system for data recording and analysis.
        * Tests show correlation between visual and measured reflectance.
* The invention includes a probe with a casing and aperture, fiber optics for light transmission, and a measuring device with light sources, detectors, and processing circuitry.
    * The probe's aperture allows for small measurement areas and contact with the skin.
    * Fiber optics enable miniaturization and flexibility, allowing for easy handling and reduced dimensions.
    * The measuring device compensates for light variations and ambient light, using digital processing for accurate measurements.
    * The apparatus can be integrated with a computer for data recording and analysis.
    * Tests demonstrate the apparatus's effectiveness in measuring skin reflectance.
* The invention's measuring device includes light-emitting and receiving means, a processing unit, and a display device.
    * The device measures

<summary>
* The invention relates to a dental apparatus that combines teeth cleaning with gum massaging.
    * It features a mouthpiece with upper and lower channel members that fit snugly against the teeth and gums.
    * The channel members are made of a soft, semi-rigid material with holes for functionality.
* The apparatus includes a membrane structure and pneumatic means to massage the gums.
    * Air pulses are used to inflate and deflate air-sacks, causing the channel members to massage the gums.
* Hydraulic means are provided to clean the teeth and gingival crevices, and to lubricate the gums during massaging.
    * A source of water or cleaning fluid is also provided, which can be mixed with water or used alone.
* The apparatus can be operated with air, water, or both, and can be controlled by a remote control device.
    * The device includes a control box with three switches for different modes of operation.
* The invention can be modified, such as by adding bristles or using a single coupling arrangement.
* The apparatus is designed to improve dental health by providing a more effective cleaning and massaging action than traditional brushing, toothpicks, or dental floss.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to pelvic floor reconstruction using implants, specifically for treating pelvic organ prolapse (POP).
  * The invention introduces a needle for surgically threading implant straps through tissue from the accessible side.
    * The needle includes a trap for the strap, a threading tip, and a release mechanism driven from the accessible side.
    * The trap may comprise a niche for inserting the strap end and a rod for grasping it.
    * The release mechanism may be manually driven and comprises a cable for removing the rod from the strap end.
* The invention also includes an anterior implant with at least two straps threaded into ATFP and SS ligaments, and a loop for anchoring to the cervix.
    * The implant is used for reconstructing the urinary bladder, colon, and small intestine.
    * The implant may include spaces to reduce its weight.
* The invention also includes a posterior implant with at least two straps threaded into SS ligaments, a loop for anchoring to the cervix, and a loop for anchoring to the perineal body.
    * The implant is used for reconstructing the colon, small intestine, and uterus.
    * The implant may also include spaces to reduce its weight.
* The invention provides a method for using the needle to thread the straps of the implants from the accessible side of the tissue.
    * The method includes trapping the strap end, threading the needle with the trapped strap, releasing the trap, and returning the needle to the accessible side.
    * The trapping of the strap end may involve inserting the end into a niche and grasping it with a rod.
    * The release mechanism may involve removing the rod from the strap end.
* The invention provides a method for installing the anterior implant by threading at least two straps into ATFP and SS ligaments and anchoring a loop between the straps to the cervix.
    * The implant is used for reconstructing the urinary bladder, colon, and small intestine.
    * The implant may include spaces for reducing its weight.

<summary>
• Field of Invention: Methods and apparatus for ventilatory assistance matching a subject's respiratory need, suitable for spontaneously or non-spontaneously breathing subjects, especially during sleep.
  • Background: Subjects with severe lung or neuromuscular diseases may require mechanical ventilation, with current devices failing to match the subject's spontaneous efforts, leading to discomfort or inefficiency.
  • Disclosure: The invention aims to closely match the phase and degree of assistance to the subject's spontaneous efforts, automatically adjust assistance to maintain minimum ventilation, and provide immunity to sudden leaks.
  • Description: The invention uses fuzzy logic to determine the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle and calculate the instantaneous inspired volume, with methods for providing ventilatory assistance based on the subject's respiratory airflow and phase.
  • First Embodiment: A ventilator that operates in various modes, including CPAP, bilevel spontaneous, and volume cycled ventilation, with adjustable parameters for patient-specific needs.
  • Second Embodiment: A ventilator that uses a smooth pressure waveform with adjustable time constant, fuzzy logic for phase detection and leak detection, and servo-control for minute ventilation, suitable for patients with varying respiratory mechanics and abnormalities.
• Initialization: User-adjustable parameters are specified and stored, including maximum permissible mask pressure, minimum permissible mask pressure, target ventilation, target frequency, target duty cycle, linear resistance, elastance, waveform time constant, hose resistance, and diffuser conductance.
• Operations Performed Every 20 Milliseconds: Measure flow and pressure, calculate mask flow and pressure, calculate conductance of leak, calculate respiratory airflow and low pass filtered respiratory airflow, calculate mask on/off status and lead-in, calculate instantaneous and recent peak jamming, calculate time constant for leak conductance calculations, calculate phase in respiratory cycle, update mean rates of change of phase, add hose pressure loss to EPAP pressure, add resistive unloading, calculate instantaneous elastic assistance required to servo-control ventilation, estimate instantaneous elastic recoil pressure, add ser

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a novel electro-surgical dissection and cauterization instrument designed for laparoscopic/endoscopic procedures.
        • It features a rigid arm extending between the distal working tip electrode and the insulating sleeve to reduce obstruction of the surgeon's view.
        • The arm includes portions laterally offset from the sleeve's longitudinal axis, enhancing visualization of the surgical site.
        • An insulating jacket on the arm prevents unintentional cauterization of healthy tissue.
        • The instrument is single-use, disposable, and designed for easy handling by the surgeon.
        • It can be connected to a conventional electro-surgical unit for electrical energy supply.
        • The working tip electrode comes in various shapes, such as hooks and flattened spatulas, for different surgical applications.
        • The invention has been shown with three embodiments, each with a different arm configuration and working tip electrode shape.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) apparatus that allows for high-contrast exposures in a short time, even for larger body segments.
        • The MRI apparatus includes a magnet with at least one patient receptacle and at least one support plate, along with a predetermined number of transmit and/or receive coils.
        • The apparatus allows exposures in at least two predetermined positions using predetermined adjustment parameters.
        • The required adjustment parameters are determined in a preceding adjustment process, rather than immediately before each exposure.
        • The adjustment parameters are stored until the conclusion of the examination, enabling quick switching of coils and reduced examination times.
        • The invention is suitable for various forms of MRI apparatuses, including cylindrical and horseshoe magnets.
        • The adjustment process precedes the exposure process, with adjustment parameters determined during measurement preparation.
        • The stored adjustment parameters are used for each position of the support plate during the examination, eliminating the need for individual adjustments per exposure.
        • The invention facilitates the tracking of contrast agent flow in larger body regions without chronological gaps, improving image quality and reducing examination times.
        • The inventors intend to embody all changes and modifications within the scope of their contribution to the art.
</summary>

<summary>
    • Objective: Provide a new sulky construction using lightweight materials
        • Design allows for easy assembly by user
            • Utilizes flat, easily stored components
            • Requires minimal space during storage and transportation
        • Employs inexpensive semi-produced components
            • Casted elements and extruded profiles for cost-effective manufacturing
        • Ensures stable construction with load transfer to wheel planes
            • Shafts and crossbar fastened without welding
            • Design integrates suspension details in casting process
        • Achieves significant weight reduction (~40%)
            • Reduces total sulky weight to approximately 18 kg
        • Facilitates easy color customization
            • Color tapes applied for individual display
    • Detailed embodiment description
        • Sulky features two wheels on a common frame with a driver's seat
            • End frames symmetrically arranged for stability
            • Crossbar and shafts fastened using bolts and screws
            • Strengthening elements ensure secure assembly without play
        • End frames cast in a single tool for cost and storage efficiency
            • Reinforced central region of crossbar for maximum bending moment
        • Sulky packed flat for easy storage and transportation
            • User-assembled sulky with professional quality
            • End frames identical for left or right side placement
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a ventilation system for rotating water feeds in water-cooled generators.
    * It addresses the issue of air accumulation at the axis of rotation, which can lead to overheating and clogging.
    * The invention aims to provide a simple and effective solution for bubble removal in rotating pipes.
* The invention includes a bypass arrangement between the feed and discharge ducts with at least one inlet and outlet.
    * The bypass utilizes the pressure gradient for automatic operation.
    * It can be arranged in various forms, including radially arranged or coiled pipes.
* The invention offers advantages such as reduced leakage, minimized bypass flow, and smaller outer dimensions due to increased hydrodynamic resistance.
    * The invention can be adapted to different structural solutions without departing from its principles.
* The invention's effectiveness is demonstrated through various embodiments, including T-pipe, radially arranged pipe, and coiled pipe designs.
    * The invention's design allows for the inlet to be advantageously located in the space around the axis of rotation for optimal bubble removal.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a steering column for motor vehicles with a jacket unit that supports the steering shaft and a retaining part connected by a break-away connection for energy absorption.
    * The jacket unit is prestressed to reduce the force required to release the break-away connection during a crash.
        * The retaining part is formed by a part of the securement device and is adjustable in length.
            * The securement device holds the jacket unit against displacement in normal operation.
            * The jacket unit can be dislocated in the event of a crash, with the retaining part moving simultaneously with the jacket unit.
    * The break-away connection is formed by a pin or other connection that is released when a force exceeding a limit value is applied.
        * The bending wire or strip used for energy absorption can be enclosed in a housing formed by the jacket unit or the bracket unit.
            * The bending wire or strip can be developed in the shape of a U, with legs connected to both the retaining part and the jacket unit.
            * The bending wire or strip can be elastically prestressed during assembly to provide a reset force.
            * The energy absorption behavior can be controlled by the cross section and course of the bending wire or strip.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a process for installing curved glass windows in vehicles using flat, uncontoured glass panels.
    • The method involves flexing the flat glass to fit the curved window opening and securing it with a reveal molding and resilient clips.
    • A continuous bead of adhesive sealant is applied between the glass panel and the window opening.
    • The reveal molding has a resilient bias that maintains the glass panel's curvature.
    • The glass panel is held in place until the adhesive cures, permanently fixing the glass in its curved shape.
    • The invention uses inexpensive flat glass and avoids the need for pre-contouring or tempering.
    • The reveal molding and clips are designed to be easily installed and replaceable.
    • The adhesive sealant is a curable polysulfide that bonds with the glass and provides a weatherproof seal.
    • The invention allows for easy replacement of the glass panel if needed.
    • The process reduces the cost and complexity of installing curved glass windows in vehicles.
    • The invention maintains the structural integrity of the vehicle during accidents by preventing glass dislodgement.
    • The invention provides a more flexible and less brittle alternative to pre-contoured glass.
    • The invention can be applied to other vehicle windows and similar applications.
    • The invention offers a cost-effective solution for manufacturers and consumers.
    • The invention improves the safety and durability of vehicle windows.
    • The invention simplifies the installation process and reduces the need for specialized equipment.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to methods and apparatus for removing a gas from a liquid, particularly oxygen from water on offshore hydrocarbon recovery platforms.
    * It provides a mechanical, cylindrical gas scavenger machine with reduced height compared to conventional stripping towers.
        * The apparatus includes a vessel divided into chambers for sequential gasification and mixing with a second gas to displace the first gas.
        * The apparatus can be used on floating offshore platforms and is designed to minimize corrosion by reducing oxygen content in water.
</summary>

<summary>
• The application claims foreign priority benefits under U.S. patent law for a European patent application.
    • The disclosed packaging machine features a plurality of synchronized work stations arranged in production direction.
    • The machine includes movable tool members in each work station for various packaging steps.
    • The conventional packaging machine has separate drives for each work station, making synchronization difficult.
    • The present disclosure introduces a packaging machine with a single, rotationally driven shaft for synchronizing tool movements.
    • The shaft and tool members are connected via transfer mechanisms like toggle levers or cams, ensuring mechanical synchronization.
    • The shaft can be driven continuously or alternately for different tool movements.
    • The machine can have work stations on different vertical levels for a compact design.
    • The frame supports the shaft and minimizes vibrations.
    • The shaft can drive tool members for forming, sealing, and separating operations.
    • Transfer mechanisms can be symmetrically arranged for uniform force distribution.
    • The disclosure allows for various modifications and additional work stations.
    • The machine can accommodate replaceable tool components with easy media connection management.
    • A lifting device can adjust the feed system for better packaging material handling.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to finishing articles with a mounting hub permanently affixed for quick attachment and release to a power tool.
	• The hub assembly includes a backing flange with radially extending gripping means and a retaining nut positioned on the opposite side.
	• The retaining nut extends through an opening in the wheel and has a radial flange at one end for securing the nut and flange together without adhesives.
	• A pressure cap defines a central opening and is held in place by the gripping means, engaging the power tool spindle seat for compression during use.
	• The pressure cap includes a rear surface for engaging the spindle seat and a front surface for contacting the continuous rib of the flange.
	• The pressure cap is constructed of molded plastic and has stiffening ribs for transmitting operational forces.
	• The gripping ribs and fingers prevent relative rotation of the wheel with respect to the hub during use.
	• The invention accommodates standard sizes of depressed center grinding wheels and is less expensive and lighter than prior art devices.
	• The assembly is simple to assemble, securely holds the article during operation, and is vibration-free.
	• The invention eliminates the need for adhesives, reducing manufacturing labor and costs.
	• The hub assembly is designed to be easily disposed of with the spent wheel, saving space in shipping and packaging.
• The invention provides a secure attachment of the abrasive finishing article to the power tool without the use of adhesives.
	• The gripping means and pressure cap ensure the wheel is held firmly in place during operation.
	• The design allows for easy assembly and disassembly of the wheel, with the pressure cap being difficult to remove without a tool.
	• The invention meets all safety standards and provides a smooth operation without vibration.
• The invention is suitable for various types of disposable finishing articles, not limited to grinding wheels.
	• The backing flange and retaining nut are constructed from materials like aluminum, steel, or molded plastic.
	• The pressure cap is designed for easy snapping into place and is constructed to withstand operational forces.
• The invention offers a cost-

<summary>
* The invention introduces a hydraulic unit for vehicle brakes that diverts pressure fluid away from electrical components, enhancing protection and cost savings.
* * The unit features a housing block and motor assembly that can be immersed without risk of damage.
* * The design allows for dual use of conduit portions, reducing production costs and simplifying cleaning.
* * The invention also includes a sealing mechanism that prevents water invasion and equalizes pressure between the motor and housing, eliminating the need for a separate pressure equalization hose.
* * The embodiments showcase various configurations for diverting pressure fluid and maintaining pressure equilibrium, with the potential for cost-effective production and improved protection of electrical components.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a conveyor system that allows for the transfer of carriers from one predetermined path to another with minimal time and cost.
    * A third dog is added to the carrier, which is normally held out of operative position by the track but can be moved to operative position for transfer.
    * The second and third dogs include cam projections that engage portions of the track to hold them out of or into operative position, respectively.
    * The system can accommodate both short and long distance transfers by selectively engaging the second or third dog as needed.
* The invention also includes an exit system where the carrier is pushed across a greater gap than in the primary system.
    * The third dog is used for long distance transfers, while the second dog can be used for short distance transfers.
    * The system can be operated by moving the dogs upwardly simultaneously or sequentially, depending on the desired transfer distance.
</summary>

<summary>
• Priority claim based on Provisional Application Serial No. 60/042,080 filed Mar. 28, 1997
    • Rail car truck bowl liners come in several categories
    • Prior art liners had disadvantages such as need for lubrication or nonconductivity
    • Invention relates to a grounding product for all polymeric type rail car center plate assembly bowl liners
• Invention provides for effective grounding without additional conductive components
    • Liner material has improved electrical properties
    • Invention exceeds NFPA standards for static electricity conductivity
• Invention eliminates the need for separate grounding apparatus
    • Previous grounding methods are subject to wear and tear
    • Invention's conductive liner allows for discharge of electrical charge
• Invention's liner is composed of UHMW-PE mixed with conductive material
    • Preferred composition is UHMW-PE with 2% carbon black
• Invention's liner has self-lubricating properties and improved wear resistance
    • Liner resists distension, stretching, and compression
• Invention's liner configuration ensures proper swivelling action and load distribution
    • Liner forms two slip surfaces for truck swivelling action
    • Liner's conductive properties enhance grounding efficiency
• Invention's liner can be adapted to various embodiments
    • Flat horizontal disk and full bowl liner configurations are possible
    • Liner's design can be adapted to specific car needs
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a valve for controlling the dispensing of viscous substances from flexible bags or pouches, allowing one-handed operation.
    • The valve is designed to be mounted on the spout of the bag and includes a tubular sleeve with a dispensing package extending through it.
    • A guide extends at a right angle to the axis of the sleeve, carrying a reciprocable gate that can be operated by engaging lugs with the fingers.
    • The gate and guide are curved complementally transversely, allowing for effective sealing when closed but variable flow when opened.
    • The valve assembly can be disassembled for cleaning and reassembled easily.
    • The valve can function when the valve assembly is in an inclined position, making it suitable for use in dispensers.
    • The valve can be operated with one hand, with the other hand free for other tasks.
    • The valve assembly includes a spout insert mounting sleeve with sealing ribs and a passage with a substantially annular sealing edge.
    • The gate valve member is curved transversely and engages with the guide plate on the opposite side of the sleeve.
    • The gate valve member can be moved between opened and closed positions by engaging lugs with the fingers.
    • The valve assembly can be mounted in a dispenser housing with a vertical slot to hold the spout and valve assembly in position.
    • An extension on the spout can be used to prevent bag collapse and lock the valve assembly in place.
    • The valve assembly can be easily disassembled for cleaning and reassembly.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention introduces a vehicular rearview mirror system that adapts to different vehicle control output protocols, particularly reverse-gear indication signals.
        • • The system includes a variable reflective element and a mirror control that determines the protocol of the vehicle control output.
            • • The mirror control can be a microcomputer that processes the output to establish the protocol.
            • • The system can accommodate various types of vehicle control outputs, such as gear status, engine, alarm, or door status information.
            • • The microcomputer may monitor the output upon starting or running the vehicle to determine the protocol.
    • The invention employs a software-based protocol determination technique to identify the handshake of the vehicle control output.
        • • • The technique uses a logical sequence of events to determine the protocol, with initial assumptions that may be revised based on vehicle operation.
            • • • The running average of the reverse-gear indication is adjusted over time to reflect the vehicle's typical usage patterns.
            • • • The ignition-cycle average is used to reduce anomalies and ensure accurate protocol determination.
            • • • The system can be implemented with minimal additional hardware, as it may utilize existing microcomputers in the vehicle mirror control system.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces an anti-dive device integrated with an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles, featuring a damped telescopic front suspension.
    * The anti-dive device is responsive to brake force applied to the front wheel, utilizing either hydraulic pressure modulation or actual braking force reaction.
    * The system aims to minimize vertical vibration of the chassis, improve front wheel braking, and enhance braking efficiency by quickly increasing the grounding load on the front wheel during braking.
</summary>
