<summary>
    • The invention introduces a novel sanitizable rotary valve for liquid chromatography, addressing the need for in-place sanitization without disassembly.
        • The valve integrates a diaphragm-like elastomeric seal for fluid-tight sealing and sanitization.
            • The seal has dynamic wipe sealing lips for maintaining contact during normal operation and allows for sanitizing fluid to be flushed across the sealing faces.
            • The valve design includes a flexible wiping lip seal on the rotor diaphragm for flushing and cleaning.
            • The design ensures containment of process fluid and barrier fluid, preventing environmental contamination.
        • The valve supports sanitization cycles with a strong sanitizing agent, followed by storage in a sanitary sealed state.
            • The valve can be used with multiple solid phase bed segments mounted on a carousel, allowing for sequential operation.
            • The invention aims to extend the life of chromatographic beds and reduce liquid consumption in separation processes.
    • The invention is particularly relevant to the pharmaceutical industry for purifying biological macromolecules.
        • It offers a simple and reliable sealing mechanism tolerant of imperfect surface flatness and particulate contamination.
            • The elastomeric seal maintains integrity over the valve's useful life, comparable to that of chromatographic beds.
            • The valve design facilitates easy removal and storage of the rotor carousel in a sanitary sealed state.
            • The invention can be adapted for use with various types of columns and media for biomolecule separation.
    • The invention is directed to a multi-port sliding valve with a linear slider and stator, featuring a diaphragm seal.
        • The diaphragm seal comprises a plurality of slider port sealing means.
            • The valve includes a connection port for sanitizing fluid and ports for process fluid connection.
            • The valve has orthogonal separation means for flushing sanitizing fluid across the stator face.
            • The invention provides a fluid barrier stream to prevent material accumulation and

<summary>
* The invention relates to gas-liquid contacting trays and improvements in valve-tray assemblies.
    * The improved tray valve assembly includes a plurality of apertures with a valve cover mounted by first and second legs.
        * The first leg intercepts the liquid flow and is wider than the second leg.
        * The legs are mounted in slotted portions to define the valve orientation.
        * The valve includes means for selectively biasing the rear region upwardly to facilitate initial vapor flow.
* The invention also includes an improved method for mixing vapor with liquid on a tray.
    * The tray is formed with a plurality of directional thrust valves.
        * The valves are circular discs with first and second legs for directing flow.
        * The legs are disposed along a line perpendicular to the downcomer and parallel to the flow.
        * The valve discs are formed with flange portions to lock the disc in place and prevent upward lifting.
        * The valve apertures may have notches to prevent disc rotation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure.
    * It reduces variances in output pressure caused by large differences in input pressure.
        * It is inexpensive to manufacture and maintain.
        * It is lightweight and portable.
        * It reduces the size and cost of a regulator needed to regulate fluid pressure.
* The invention comprises a pressurized fluid source coupled to a high-pressure line connected to a vane motor.
    * The vane motor is coupled to a fluid regulator connected to an output line leading to a burner or other component.
        * A generator is coupled to the vane motor to convert pressurized fluid into mechanical or electrical power.
* The vane motor is constructed with an inner drum and vane assemblies, which rotate to create mechanical motion.
    * The drum shaft is coupled to a back plate and a guide block, allowing longitudinal movement but preventing lateral movement.
        * The vanes extend and retract relative to the drum, changing drag coefficients to optimize torque.
        * The vanes are secured with wear-resistant tips and are positioned to minimize reverse torque.
* The generator converts mechanical motion into electrical power, which can be used for various functions.
    * The invention can be adapted to various applications, such as gas grills, scuba diving gear, or vehicles powered by pressurized fluids.
        * It allows for the use of smaller or less expensive pressure regulators by performing some of the work typically done by a pressure regulator.
        * The motor and generator can be of any suitable design and dimensions to accommodate desired pressures.
* The invention can be modified to include different types of motors and generators.
        * It can be used to recover work from pressurized fluids in various applications.
* The invention is not limited to a specific embodiment and can be adapted to suit different needs.
        * It can utilize any type of power storage or transmission device.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a pallet system designed to support and secure loads of items, such as stackable trays, while limiting their movement during shipping.
* The system features parallel guide rails raised above the pallet's top surface, with open spaces between them for packing items.
* End plates are vertically positioned at the pallet's ends, shaped to complement the trays' contours and secured to the stacked trays, often by wrapping.
* The pallet system restricts lateral and longitudinal movement of items, enhancing stability and allowing for automated loading and unloading.
* The invention can be customized for different loads and pallet sizes, with various materials and manufacturing methods for components.
* End plates may be interchangeable and nest within one another to save space when not in use.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an electrical driven flying saucer with a magnetic suspension system.
    * The saucer shell houses the rotary-wing system and power system, which are compactly designed to fit within the limited internal space.
    * The rotary-wing system comprises magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail.
    * The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels are suspended radially and axially by magnetic forces, avoiding contact with the saucer shell and reducing noise and vibration.
    * The system includes two sets of coaxial magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems, either axially or radially, to counteract reactive torque and improve stability and control.
    * The design enhances power performance and operational safety, with high motive power conversion efficiency and easy manipulation and control.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to streptavidin muteins with enhanced binding affinity for peptide ligands, specifically for the strep-tag II sequence.
        • These muteins are characterized by mutations in the amino acid positions 44 to 53 of streptavidin, resulting in an affinity constant significantly higher than that of wild-type streptavidin.
        • Preferred muteins have a binding affinity at least a factor of 10 higher than wt-streptavidin for the strep-tag II sequence.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention also includes a process for producing streptavidin muteins using recombinant DNA technology.
        • The process involves transforming a suitable host cell with a vector containing a nucleic acid sequence coding for the streptavidin mutein.
        • The host cell is cultured under conditions that promote the expression of the streptavidin mutein, which can be isolated and purified for use in various applications.
</summary>

<summary>
    • Streptavidin muteins can be used in place of conventional streptavidin/biotin systems for the isolation, purification, and detection of proteins, especially when higher binding strength is desired.
        • The muteins can be immobilized on solid phases for protein immobilization or used in affinity chromatography for purification.
        • The muteins can also be used in detection methods, such as ELISA or Western blot, with various labeling groups.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to methods of forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts, particularly Ni(0) catalysts derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, and other nickel catalysts.
    • The guanidine functional group is significant in many drugs, and methods for its synthesis under mild conditions with minimal reagents are valuable.
    • The invention uses thioureas and isothioureas as guanylating agents, with preferred protecting groups like Boc and Cbz.
    • The reactions are carried out at room temperature or under ambient conditions, with yields of at least 85% after 2 hours.
    • The nickel catalyst is present at less than about 10 molar % nickel, and the reaction can be optimized with various solvents.
    • The invention includes examples of guanylation reactions with different amines and guanylating agents, demonstrating the versatility and effectiveness of the method.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a novel apparatus and method for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum or aluminum alloy strips or wires.
  * The apparatus continuously conducts an anodic oxidation and an electrolytic coloring of aluminum without the need for a large amount of electrical energy.
  * The method produces a colored anodic coating on the aluminum strip or wire with excellent weatherability or fade resistance.
  * The apparatus does not require the continuous connection of the aluminum strip or wire directly to a power source.
  * The anodic oxidation bath typically contains sulfuric acid, and the electrolytic coloring bath contains a nickel salt, a cobalt salt, a copper salt, a tin salt, and selenious acid.
  * The thickness of the oxide film formed on the aluminum strip or wire during anodization is controlled to be thicker than 4 microns for better coloring.
  * The color of the oxide film can be controlled by varying the thickness of the oxide film, the composition of the electrolytic coloring bath, and the electrolytic conditions.
  * The apparatus includes a means for continuously supplying the aluminum strip or wire, an anodic oxidation bath, an electrolytic coloring bath, and a means for passing the aluminum strip or wire through the baths.
  * The aluminum strip or wire acts as an anode in the anodic oxidation bath and as a cathode in the electrolytic coloring bath without direct connection to a power source.
  * The apparatus can produce continuously and cost-effectively colored aluminum strips or wires with superior weatherability or fade resistance.
  * The invention can be practically implemented with various modifications within its scope.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a process of producing transgenic plants with a DNA sequence of interest integrated into their chromosomes, capable of expressing a desired function from that sequence.
    * The process involves providing plant cells or plants with at least two different vectors adapted for site-specific recombination and integration into chromosomes.
        * The vectors contain sequence portions necessary for expressing the desired function and are designed for in planta recombination and integration.
        * The recombination product is non-replicating to avoid disease symptoms.
        * Transgenic plants expressing the desired function are selected, and those not expressing the function or expressing an undesired function are eliminated.
        * The process allows for the creation of transgenic plant libraries for screening and functional genomics studies.
* The invention also provides transgenic plants or parts thereof, like seeds, produced or obtainable by this process.
    * The DNA sequences integrated into the plants are of plant origin, ensuring no unnatural sequences are outcrossed.
    * The process can be used for introducing genes to be expressed in plant chromosomes, with applications in gene function analysis and directed evolution.
    * The invention enables the assembly of complex DNA sequences in planta, reducing cloning work and vector size.
    * It allows for the screening of DNA libraries for desired functions in plants, potentially speeding up the process of identifying beneficial genetic combinations.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a swash plate type compressor with a coated swash plate for reducing friction and wear.
    * The coating is a heat-curable, cross-linked polyfluoro elastomer with lubricious and load-bearing additives.
    * The coating can be applied to non-hypereutectic aluminum alloys, eliminating the need for expensive, high-silicon base materials.
    * The coating process does not require high surface finishes, unlike previous methods.
    * The coating improves durability and efficiency, with experimental results showing increased seizure loads and reduced friction coefficients.
    * The coating adheres well to the swash plate due to a combination of mechanical and chemical bonding.
    * The coating's durability is enhanced by the inclusion of load-bearing additives, reducing the need for metal coatings or hypereutectic base materials.
    * The coating process can potentially eliminate machining steps in swash plate manufacturing.
    * The coating maintains a low friction coefficient throughout testing, with non-hypereutectic aluminum performing equally or better than hypereutectic aluminum.
    * The coating thickness can be controlled through the application process, with a preferred thickness of approximately 0.0012 inches (30 μm).
    * The coating process can be adapted for various aluminum alloys and does not require the swash plate to be machined to a high polish.
    * The coating process includes a curing step at an elevated temperature to cross-link the polyfluoro elastomer.
    * The coating process can be applied using a liquid spray method, with the swash plate surface roughened to improve adhesion.
    * The coating process is commercially available and the preferred coating is Fluorolon™325 by Impreglon Inc.
    * The coating process is suitable for automotive air conditioning systems and can be used with existing swash plate designs.
    * The invention provides a cost-effective and efficient solution for swash plate compressors, with potential applications in other high-friction environments.

<summary>
* The invention introduces novel organic polymers and methods for creating anti-reflective coatings for semiconductor devices, particularly for photolithography processes using 193 nm and 248 nm light beams.
    * * The polymers are designed to absorb light strongly at these wavelengths, preventing reflection and the standing wave effect.
        * * * The polymers are cross-linked and form a stable structure upon hard-baking.
            * * * * The coatings are insoluble in solvents after hard-baking, avoiding issues like cutting or footing during pattern formation.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic with a thickness of 10 to 350 μm, which includes at least one white pigment, one UV absorber, and one flame retardant.
        • The film has good orientability, mechanical and optical properties, and can be produced cost-effectively.
        • It passes fire tests and the UL 94 test, indicating it is suitable for outdoor and critical indoor applications without yellowing, embrittlement, or surface cracking over time.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to an improved method for producing 1,1,1-trifluoroethane (143a) by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane (142b) using heterogeneous catalysis.
        • The process achieves very high conversion and selectivity (over 99%) for 143a, avoiding the formation of olefinic byproducts.
            • The catalyst used can be any chromium salt, supported or unsupported, and may include co-catalysts like nickel, cobalt, and manganese salts.
            • The process can be carried out at temperatures between 30° C. and 400° C., with a preferred range of 100° C. to 280° C.
            • The HF/142b molar ratio should be greater than 1:1 to avoid olefin formation, with a minimum of 2.5:1 at temperatures above 280° C.
            • The process can be run under adiabatic conditions in a continuous, plug flow reactor.
    • The invention also includes a method for removing low levels of olefinic material from 143a using a post-reactor with a lower temperature (25° C. to 200° C.).
        • The post-reactor uses the same Cr/Ni/AlF3 catalyst as the main reactor and operates at a lower temperature to convert olefins to saturated compounds.
            • The process can handle feed compositions containing olefins without affecting the catalyst performance.
            • The process can be carried out at higher pressures, with the reactor operating at 300° C. and 125 psig.
            • The post-reactor can remove olefins without distilling HCl or HF from the crude product.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to an improved process for synthesizing pyrazolotriazoles from triazolothiadiazine precursors, employing hypophosphorous acid for deacylation and desulfurization.
        • Hypophosphorous acid reduces undesirable by-products and increases yield.
        • Hydrogen sulfide is the by-product, which is easily removed due to its gaseous nature and reactivity.
    • The process is advantageous over previous methods due to reduced impurities and increased product yield.
        • The invention is adaptable by industry and does not affect other functional groups in the molecule.
    • The process can be conducted with a variety of inert substituents (R and R') that meet specific stability and non-reactivity criteria.
        • The invention includes a two-step process: acylation followed by deacylation/desulfurization in the presence of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric acid or hydrobromic acid.
    • The reaction conditions include temperatures from 100° C. to 150° C., ambient pressure, and a reaction time of 0.5 to 10 hours.
    • The invention provides examples of the synthesis of specific pyrazolotriazole compounds, demonstrating the practical application of the process.
        • Examples include 6-methyl-3-[1-(4-nitrophenoxy)tridecyl]-1H-pyrazolo-[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole and 6-t-butyl-3-(3nitro-2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazolo-[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole.
        • The process involves heating, cooling, and washing steps, with the final product isolated by filtration and washing.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from different fiber types.
    * The method ensures no fiber residuals and an optimally homogeneous mixture.
        * It measures the entire momentary quantity of each fiber bale before each pass.
            * A predetermined partial quantity corresponding to a predetermined proportion of the momentary entire quantity is continuously removed from each fiber bale.
            * The partial quantity is determined anew for each fiber bale before each pass.
            * The operation is repeated in the same manner during successive passes.
    * The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device.
        * The quantity measuring device is a height-measuring device that determines the partial fiber quantities to be removed.
            * The control device controls the fiber removing operation based on signals from the quantity measuring device.
            * The control device also ensures a predetermined time schedule for removing the partial quantities.
            * The drive of the bale opener can be accelerated to remove the partial quantities within the predetermined period.
* The invention is particularly adapted for making mixtures of constant quantity proportions.
    * The apparatus can be time-controlled and quantity-controlled.
        * The fiber removing operation can be programmed to obtain a predetermined quantity of fine fiber tufts in a predetermined mixture ratio in a predetermined time period.
        * The apparatus can ensure a supply of after-connected processing machines with fiber tufts by coordinating the output rate of the bale opener with that of the after-connected machines.
* The invention includes a preferred embodiment with a series of textile fiber bales arranged side-by-side on a bale support.
    * A carriage with two spiked fiber bale opener aprons moves under the bale support.
        * A height-measuring device measures the total height of each fiber bale before each pass.
            * A predetermined partial quantity is calculated and removed from each fiber bale during each pass.
            * The number of passes remaining is reduced by one after each pass.

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns at an angle of 30° to 150° to the fabric's long axis, held together by stitching, knitting, or adhesive bonding.
        • The invention improves upon prior art by achieving fully parallel courses of yarns without complex machinery.
            • A rake mechanism synchronized with the conveyors and yarn carriers ensures parallelism and controlled fabric density.
            • The rake system allows for partial overlap of yarn courses, enhancing fabric strength and uniformity.
    • The invention includes a pair of parallel conveyors with needles for yarn placement, and yarn carriers that can be slowed down for better parallelism.
        • The yarn carriers can be keyed to an oscillating crank mechanism for controlled speed reduction.
            • The invention allows for greater density and uniformity without requiring a one-to-one correspondence between yarns and needles.
    • The invention is applicable to the formation of structural parts, such as those used in high-speed airplanes.
        • The fabric is impregnated with a curable resin system after being held together by the bonding mechanism.
            • The invention's flexibility extends to various bonding methods, including stitching, knitting, or adhesive application.
            • The invention's scope is not limited to the specific embodiments illustrated, allowing for variations within its spirit and scope.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a method and apparatus for weft insertion in a multiple-color air jet loom, providing different weft carrying forces for different weft threads.
        • The invention achieves this by ejecting air from main nozzles and subnozzles under different pressures or for different intervals of time, depending on the selected weft thread.
        • Subnozzles are divided into groups along the warp shed to produce combined air streams of varying pressures.
        • A valve and control system is used to selectively open the valve for different intervals of time, synchronized with the operation of the loom.
        • The arrangement allows for stable weft insertion at a constant period of time, avoiding undue consumption of pressurized air.
        • The invention can be applied to looms using more than two different weft threads and can replace subnozzles in multiple-color air jet looms.
        • The main nozzle and piping system with the control system can be incorporated in a loom without subnozzles, with pressurized air ejected at the same time or sequentially from the subnozzles.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres, with a process that includes health preserving the fibres and blending them with other fibres.
    * The process involves specific steps of health preserving, opening, cleaning, carding, drawing into strips, and spinning into yarn.
    * The health preservation step can be conducted under various temperature and humidity conditions, and the duration can range from 2 to 14 hours.
    * The invention also covers blended spinning of bast fibres with other fibres, following similar steps but with the addition of blending.
* The invention aims to reduce the end breakage rate of bast fibre yarn, which is significantly lowered through the process.
    * Examples of experiments demonstrate the effectiveness of the invention, with end breakage rates reduced to averagely 150-200 times per hour for jute fibre yarn and 150 times per hour for multi-fibre yarn.
* The invention can be modified within the art and is intended to cover variations and adaptations, as well as departures from the disclosure that fall within known or customary practice.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to nip presses with sensing rolls that measure and compensate for rotational variability to provide accurate nip pressure profiles.
        • Sensing rolls include multiple sensors placed circumferentially at cross-directional positions to measure pressure as the roll rotates.
            • Sensors are spaced apart to average out rotational variability effects, with configurations such as 180°, 120°, and 90° separations.
            • The averaged pressure measurements are used to calculate and display accurate nip pressure profiles, with the potential to also measure rotational variability profiles.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces a cord support and holder system for an ironing board, featuring a clamp that securely attaches to the board and a flexible cord support that holds the iron's cord above the surface.
  * The clamp, shaped like a "C", has a leg portion that engages the ironing surface and another that adjusts to hold the cord support in place.
  * The cord support includes a flexible mast with a coiled spring section that allows the cord to be positioned above the ironing surface and retracted when not in use.
* The system also includes a detachable article holder with a base for holding items like spray starch cans or beverage containers, which can be removed for storage convenience.
  * The article holder is mounted to the clamp and includes a base and vertical supports for spacing and stability.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a buttonhole controlling device for sewing machines.
    * It addresses the issue of inconsistent buttonhole formation across different materials.
    * The device automatically adjusts the buttonhole length to prevent stitching overlap or incomplete closure.
    * It includes a foot pad, a travelling assembly, and an adjustable stop.
    * The device is similar to the one disclosed in U.S. Pat. No. 3,877,403.
    * The foot pad attaches to the presser bar and includes a slidable member for positioning a button.
    * The travelling assembly moves with the work and includes a stop to engage the tripping lever at the desired buttonhole closure point.
    * The adjustable stop allows the operator to precisely define the closure point for different materials.
    * The device can be used with various sewing machines, including the "TOUCH-TRONIC" 2001 electronic sewing machine.
    * The invention provides a solution for creating consistent and high-quality buttonholes in garments made of different materials.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved apparatus for treating dyed or printed textile webs with a liquid, such as a washing or rinsing solution.
* The apparatus includes a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch.
* The dwell stretch allows the textile web to be spread out and in a single layer, extending the action time of the liquid on the substances to be removed.
* The invention is particularly advantageous for soilage washing and maintains low tension in the textile web.
* The dwell stretch can be formed by an air pass with freely rotatable rollers or by a sieve drum with guide rollers.
* The apparatus can have a compact construction and is suitable for various materials, including knitted fabrics.
* The suction device is advantageously disposed near the point of return of the web to the sieve belt, guiding the web without causing tensile stresses.
* The invention can be applied in various embodiments and modifications without departing from the scope of the claimed invention.
* The drawings and descriptions are provided as examples to facilitate comprehension of the invention.
* The invention aims to improve the washing effect and maintain the integrity of the textile web.
* The invention can be used in conjunction with fastness treatments after washing.
* The invention is suitable for a wide range of textile materials and applications.
* The invention can be adapted to existing pretreatment units like dying or printing units.
* The invention can be used in the textile industry for efficient and effective fabric treatment.
* The invention can be used in conjunction with other textile processing equipment.
* The invention can be used in various textile processing applications.

<summary>
• Field of the Invention
  • Air flow system for dry cleaners
    • Induces ambient air into access opening when door is opened
    • Reduces exhausting of residual solvent vapors from tubs
    • Separate intake fan and duct
    • Normally closed valve isolates intake system from solvent vapors during normal operation

• Description of the Prior Art
  • Safety feature in dry cleaning machines
    • Draws ambient air through access opening
    • Minimizes escape of toxic solvent vapors
    • Common ducts with diverter valve for air flow direction

• Summary of the Invention
  • Dry cleaner with separate air flow system
    • Reduces solvent vapor loss
    • Intake fan and duct interposed between access opening and tub ends
    • Valve opens to draw air into access opening when door is opened

• Description of the Preferred Embodiment
  • Dry cleaner with solvent flow, air flow, and solvent vapor handling systems
    • Separate systems for solvent and air flow
    • Air flow system isolates tubs from air circulation during spin cycle
    • Solvent vapor handling system retains vapors within machine
    • Refrigeration system cools solvent in storage tank

• Controls
  • Timer mechanism controls machine operation
    • Automatic cycle with timer-driven motor
    • Manual override for specific cycle operations
    • Cartridge dry cycle for filter maintenance

• Refrigeration System
  • Cooling solvent vapors and maintaining solvent temperature
    • Compression-type refrigeration system
    • Single compressor for cooling two evaporator coils

• Solvent Flow System
  • Continuous solvent recirculation during fill and wash
    • Solvent flows through filters and back to storage tank
    • Dump and spin cycle diverts solvent back to storage tank
    • Tumble dry with heat allows solvent vaporization in clothes

• Air Flow System
  • Ambient air drawn through access opening when door is open
    • Minimizes solvent vapor loss during air flow
    • Air flow system isol

<summary>
• The invention pertains to methods and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments, specifically improvements using non-eductive drawing.
    • It addresses limitations of conventional eductive and non-eductive systems, such as turbulence, hygiene, and uniformity issues.
    • The invention combines aspects of eductive and non-eductive systems for efficiency and simplicity.
    • It features a continuous two-dimensional slot across the machine width for uniform filament distribution.
    • The slot allows for high air and fiber velocities without structural deflection issues.
    • The system minimizes dirt, polymer drippings, and monomer build-up due to limited exposed machined surface area.
    • Cleaning is simplified, requiring only a few seconds and potentially an automatic wiper.
    • The invention allows for easy adjustment of filament denier and uniformity through slot gap opening and air flow rate control.
    • It incorporates principles from meltblown processes for better web formation control.
    • The invention is adaptable to various materials and operating conditions.
    • Test results demonstrate the invention's ability to produce fine polypropylene filaments with stable denier and psi values.
    • The invention can produce low basis weight webs for various applications, including sanitary products and industrial filtration.
    • It can also produce fine or coarse polyester filaments for automotive carpet and roofing applications.
    • The invention can form spun fibers directly into pillows and cushions or sell them as baled fibers.
• The invention is intended to cover all alternatives, modifications, and equivalents within its spirit and scope.
    • It aims to satisfy the objects, aims, and advantages set forth in the disclosure.
    • The invention is believed to encompass all variations and changes within its scope.
</summary>

<summary>
• First Embodiment
    • Sewing machine includes detecting portion, processor, and memory.
    • Detecting portion detects ultrasonic wave from transmission source.
    • Memory stores instructions to identify transmission source position and control sewing based on it.
    • Ultrasonic pen transmits wave when pressed against work cloth.
    • Receivers detect wave and CPU identifies position for sewing.
• Second Embodiment
    • Embroidery unit with receivers for ultrasonic wave detection.
    • Embroidery unit moves work cloth based on detected position.
    • Sewing machine controls embroidery frame movement and sewing based on ultrasonic wave detection.
• Third Embodiment
    • Sewing machine includes electromagnetic wave detector.
    • Ultrasonic pen outputs electromagnetic wave signal instead of ultrasonic wave.
    • Sewing machine detects electromagnetic wave signal for position identification.
• Fourth Embodiment
    • Sewing machine includes additional receiver.
    • Ultrasonic pen lacks electromagnetic wave output circuit.
    • Additional receiver detects ultrasonic wave for position identification.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials through the application of functional additives.
    • The preparations utilize wool particles or wool powder as carriers for functional additives.
    • Wool particles or powder are preferably macrofibrils, with a size of 200 nm or below, and may have a helical structure.
    • Functional additives can include anti-UV agents like zinc oxide or titanium oxide, and anti-bacterial agents like nano-silver or titanium oxide.
    • The preparations can also incorporate ultrafine bamboo powder for moisture management properties.
    • The application methods include printing, padding, or foam application, with the preparation bonded to or deposited onto the cellulosic fabric.
• The invention aims to improve the durability of functional enhancements in textiles.
    • The wool particles or powder have exceptional carrying and retention ability for functional additives.
    • The use of ultrafine wool fibers is environmentally friendly and economical, as they utilize scrapped fibers.
    • The preparations can enhance properties such as moisture management, wicking, and wrinkling resistance.
    • The invention also provides anti-UV protection and anti-bacterial properties to the treated fabrics.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to an automatic quilting machine for stitching patterns into large fabrics like bedspreads or quilts, featuring a system where the sewing machine head and the quilting table movements are controlled by separate computers.
        • The machine allows for precise pattern programming through a computer aided design program, with the capability to store and duplicate patterns.
            • Patterns can be manually drawn on a monitor using a cursor or mouse, converted into machine-readable language, and stored in the computer's memory.
            • The system simplifies reprogramming by allowing independent control of the sewing machine functions and the quilting table movements, reducing the effort required for modifications.
            • The invention can accommodate both computer-generated and hand-selected patterns, increasing the production rate of hand-guided patterns on large fabrics.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image.
    * The fabric is formed from at least two precursor webs comprising different fibrous matrices.
        * A fluid-pervious support layer or scrim is interposed between the webs to act as a fiber distribution control layer.
            * The precursor webs are subjected to hydroentanglement on a three-dimensional image transfer device.
                * The support layer prevents excessive intermingling of the fibrous constituents of the outer layers.
                    * The result is a nonwoven fabric with distinct surface performance properties on each side.
    * The fabric can exhibit a pronounced three-dimensional image and durability to abrasion and distortion.
        * The method can be applied to various applications, including cleaning wipes, medical gauze, and protective covers.
            * The fabric can be treated with post-entanglement treatments for enhanced durability or specific end-use requirements.
                * The support layer can be made from materials like spunbond nonwoven fabrics or nanofiber fabrics.
                    * The method allows for the use of staple length fibers, continuous filaments, and blends of fibers with different compositions.
                        * The invention is versatile and can accommodate various fiber profiles and deniers.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric, particularly for sewing relatively stiff strips of material without deforming the needle.
  * The device includes a control setup with a stop in the feed path of the strip, actuated by a strip of material, and connected to the sewing machine's operation.
  * The stop is mounted on a lever biased by a spring and can be adjusted by displaceable stops.
  * The stop is also connected to an air cylinder, allowing for adjustment of its position.
  * The device operates by stopping the sewing machine when the strip loses contact with a contact arm, and resumes sewing after the strip is correctly positioned.
  * The invention aims to provide a simple, rugged, and economical sewing machine control for feeding strip materials.
  * The device includes a guide chute for the strip, a stop for contacting and stopping the feed, and a control means for adjusting the stop's position.
  * The device operates through a sequence control, which starts when the strip loses contact with the contact arm, and stops the sewing machine.
  * The device ensures continuous operation and is insensitive to disturbances.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking a rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in the collar of a sweater, neck rope portion of a tanktop, lower end portion of baseball stockings, or similar items.
    * The method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds.
    * The two pieces are positioned with a boundary between them on either the front or rear needle bed.
    * The final course of one piece is overlaid across the boundary onto the other piece, and the process is repeated to gradually connect the pieces.
    * The method reduces the need for separate sewing processes, improving productivity and reducing manufacturing costs.
    * The method also reduces manual sewing, leading to more uniform products.
    * The invention can be applied to various knit fabrics and garment parts, including sweaters, tanktops, baseball stockings, and aprons.
    * The method can be implemented using a computer-controlled knitting machine following a designed knitting pattern.
    * The invention can be realized with two movable needle beds, one or both of which can be movable.
    * The method can be used with various knitting textures, such as plain knitting, rib knitting, or tubular knitting.
    * The invention can be used to link tape- or rope-shaped portions in various garment parts.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a flexible traction element with a plurality of stranded cables sheathed in a flexible thermoplastic material, suitable for lifts.
    * The traction element is produced using a production line that includes a reel for unwinding cables, a device for precise orientation, a heater, an extruder, a cooling trough, a roller store, and a cutting device.
    * The stranded cables consist of individual fibers or wires with tensile strength, and the thermoplastic material is applied in a flowable state without becoming highly liquid.
    * The production line allows for precise control of the spacing and tension of the stranded cables, ensuring uniform distance from the plastic material jacket and improved adhesion.
    * The traction elements have a wide range of uses, including lifting and pulling loads, and can meet high safety requirements.
    * The production process is efficient, with a high running speed and the ability to produce traction elements with consistent quality.
* The invention also relates to a method for embedding stranded cables in a flexible thermoplastic material, which involves degreasing or coating the cables and preheating them before embedding in the plastic material.
    * The preheating improves the adhesion between the cables and the plastic material, and the method allows for long-term durability and stability of the traction elements.
    * The method can be used for individual cables or a plurality of cables not located on a plane, and the production line can be adjusted for different applications.
    * The traction elements produced have a wide range of cross-sectional shapes and can be used in various applications, including as electric conductors.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to methods for producing silicon-based nanofibers and thin films using liquid silane inks and electrospinning techniques.
    * * The invention includes four-component and five-component liquid silane-based inks for electrospinning.
        * * * The four-component inks comprise a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent.
            * * * * The polymer is preferably poly(methyl methacrylate) or a polycarbonate.
            * * * * The solvents include toluene, xylene, cyclooctane, 1,2,4-trichlorobenzene, and dichloromethane or mixtures thereof.
            * * * * The liquid silane can be cyclohexasilane, cyclohexasilane, or 1-silylcyclopentasilane.
            * * * * The accelerant is a polyhydropolysilane.
    * * * * The five-component inks also include a solid phase component, which can be metallic particles, photoactive compounds, or reactive compounds.
        * * * * * The solid phase can comprise metal particles, semiconducting particles, or polydihydrosilane.
* The invention also includes methods for transforming the deposited nanofibers into polysilane-containing materials or amorphous/crystalline silicon materials using thermal or laser processing.
    * * * * * * The fibers can be coated with a conductive coating using chemical vapor deposition or solution deposition.
        * * * * * * The coated or non-coated nanofibers can be used as components of other composite materials, such as anodes for lithium-ion batteries.
* The invention was developed with government support and demonstrates the potential for scalable, cost-effective production of silicon-based materials for various applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a thread tension control arrangement for a spool creel with multiple spool holders.
  * Each spool holder has a brake rotor with an adjustable braking element and a tensioning lever that is biased by the thread and weight.
  * The arrangement includes a fluid pressure-sensitive biasing arrangement that influences the tensioning lever, allowing centralized control of thread tension for the entire creel.
  * The biasing arrangement can be a piston/cylinder assembly that follows the tensioning lever's movement and can be controlled by fluid pressure.
  * The biasing arrangement can also operate on a brake shoe that contacts a braking surface on the brake drum, providing rapid braking when the machine is shut off.
  * The biasing arrangement can be a pneumatic drive to prevent thread contamination.
  * The tensioning lever preferably subtends an angle greater than 45° and the biasing arrangement an angle less than 45° to ensure a substantially equal force component throughout the control range.
  * The biasing arrangement can be a magnetic system that covers a braking disc, with the braking force varying based on the position of the magnetic system.
  * The magnetic system can be controlled by a transverse lever arm connected to the tensioning lever, allowing for rapid braking when the brake shoe is pressed against the braking disc.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention introduces a sewing machine detector that addresses the limitations of conventional detectors by providing durability against vibration, a more compact design, and reduced stress on optical fibers.
        • The detector uses flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs mounted coaxially to a sewing machine shaft, with reflective and light-transmitting areas printed on them for various detections.
            • The light shielding discs are made from light-transmitting synthetic resin and are secured in place except during angle adjustments.
            • The detector includes a power indicating window and a power indicating optical fiber that runs from the module section to the detecting section, avoiding electrical interference with the sewing machine control circuitry.
            • The detector's design ensures accurate optical axes and stable operation, even with shaft vibration, and allows for easy generation of additional optical axes during assembly.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces a simplified process for producing high-degree white viscose rayon yarns.
    * The process involves partial coagulation, completion of coagulation, and washing with non-alkaline water.
        * The washing water's pH is between 4.0 and 5.5, and it contains minimal amounts of Ca2+ and Mg2+ ions.
        * The yarn is then dried and taken up on a ring twister.
* The invention achieves a high degree of white without the need for additional treatments after the completion of coagulation.
    * The degree of white is measured by the Hunter method and is not lower than 45 after drying and finishing.
        * The process is preferably carried out at spinning speeds not lower than 90 m/min.
* The invention also includes a method for obtaining the washing water by treating industrial water with weakly acid ion exchange resins.
    * The treated water has a pH between 4.0 and 5.5 and minimal amounts of Ca2+ and Mg2+ ions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention addresses the problem of oxygen entrainment in pulp during the bleaching process, which hinders vacuum operation in washing stages.
  * * The invention proposes a small deaeration tank that can operate at atmospheric or low pressure, and is preferably the same diameter as an oxygen reactor for easy placement.
  * * The deaeration tank is designed with no moving parts, eliminating the need for additional motors.
  * * The tank allows for steam or oxygen recovery and is constructed to withstand pressures of ±1 atmosphere.
  * * The deaeration process utilizes filtrate from the washer as the swirling fluid, optimizing deaeration.
  * * The inlet pipe of the tank is positioned to prevent pulp splashing and is sized to handle the incoming pulp volume.
  * * The swirling action in the tank is achieved by the tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe, which is sized and positioned to create the desired swirl.
  * * The deaeration tank has a height control mechanism to maintain a constant slurry height, ensuring a pumpable consistency of the pulp.
  * * The system includes an emergency bypass line for handling upset conditions.
  * * The invention is applicable to both pressure and vacuum washers, with the filtrate flow rate controlled by the height of the filtrate in the tank.
  * * The deaeration tank dimensions and specifications are provided for a 50 ton per day installation.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention introduces biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with enhanced out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.
        • The BTR composite structure comprises stuffer members and tendon elements interconnected in a criss-cross pattern, with the possibility of incorporating curved or flat panels and varying stuffer member lengths.
        • The tendon elements, made from materials like carbon fibers or Kevlar, are strategically placed to maximize structural performance, and the entire assembly can be embedded in a matrix material for additional strength and functionality.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames in structures prone to dynamic and/or seismic events.
        • The device can undergo plastic deformation to dissipate energy during such events.
            • It can be easily removed and replaced after deformation.
            • It may have a plastic hinge mechanism that forms during plastic deformation.
    • The device can be constructed from materials with elasto-plastic stress strain properties.
            • It may be made of metal or any material capable of plastic deformation.
            • It may avoid local stress risers that prematurely yield or fatigue.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention introduces a bedroom cabinet with dual construction for enhanced mechanical strength and a flat external surface, allowing for stacking without projecting internal boxes or devices.
    * The bedroom cabinet features an outer casing and an inner casing, with a clearance between them to accommodate boxes for devices or shelves without projecting from the cabinet's exterior.
    * The clearance also includes spacer members with venting grooves, promoting natural ventilation and sound-proofing within the room.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support for construction sites.
    • It features a flat bottomed base plate, an upright column, guard rail brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring.
    • The guard rail support can be used with a concrete-filled steel base for stability when floor anchoring is not possible.
    • The safety barrier includes overlapping wooden guard rails and a kick board, secured within the rail brackets and flange.
    • The guard rail system allows for easy installation and disassembly by a single worker.
    • It prevents damage to lumber during disassembly, ensuring reassembly integrity and safety.
    • The guard rail support is made of all-steel for durability and repeated use.
    • The guard rail system complies with safety regulations for guard rail spacing and load capacity.
    • The guard rail support can be adapted for use in various situations, such as around roof perimeters or bridge construction.
    • The invention can be modified or adapted without departing from its scope.
</summary>

* The invention pertains to enhancing oil recovery from reservoirs using a combination of pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods.
* * The invention extends the effective range of electrohydraulic stimulation through the use of electromagnetic pulses that induce high-frequency acoustic vibrations in the reservoir, overcoming the natural attenuation of acoustic waves.
* * * The invention includes a multi-level discharge device for sequential firing of sources in one well, extending the effective range of stimulation.
* * * The invention also allows for the use of multiple pulse sources in multiple wells to create a time-sequential discharge pattern, extending the range of coupled stimulation.
* * * The invention can be used in conjunction with various separation processes to recover different components from the produced fluids, including heavy metals and gases like CO2 and H2S.

<summary>
* The disclosure relates to a system and method for extending the length of soil reinforcing elements used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures.
    * A splice includes a first wave plate and a second wave plate with transverse protrusions to receive and seat corresponding transverse wires from a soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip, respectively.
    * The splice features perforations and a connective device to couple the wave plates and clamp down on the longitudinal wires of both the soil reinforcing element and the grid-strip.
    * The splice allows for the creation of a composite soil reinforcing element by coupling grid-strips to the soil reinforcing element, extending its length as required for MSE applications.
* The disclosure also introduces a composite soil reinforcing element that combines a soil reinforcing element with a grid-strip, featuring a splice that couples the two components together.
    * The composite element includes a soil reinforcing element with a wall end and a reinforcing end, and a grid-strip with a splicing end.
    * The splice for the composite element includes a first wave plate and a second wave plate with transverse protrusions to receive and seat the corresponding transverse wires, clamping down on the longitudinal wires of both components.
    * The splice allows for the extension of the soil reinforcing element's length by adding grid-strips, creating a single composite element for reinforcing a vertical facing.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a novel plow blade design that efficiently produces fluid passage and points of fluid ejection using basic manufacturing processes.
    * The design includes a multiple component assembly that allows for the rebuilding of a blade by replacing worn portions.
        * The invention also features a process for ejecting fluid at specific points along the plow blade to maximize desirable characteristics while minimizing fluid volume.
            * This method is adaptable for both static and vibratory plowing utilities.
            * Lubricating the blade/chute sides with fluid reduces ground drag significantly.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a building system for creating large stucco panels without movement control joints.
    • It allows for panels up to 4.85 meters high and 12 meters wide, or other dimensions, without mandatory movement control joints.
    • The system caters for both NZ and USA building regulations, with a preference for a 21 mm thickness panel.
    • The invention includes a reinforced plaster panel with at least one opening reinforced in the plaster matrix.
    • The invention aims to provide a choice for the public in building systems, compliance with NZ building and plaster codes, and stucco wall integrity.
    • The invention includes a building with a stucco wall of at least 2.4 m high, 4 m wide, and 21 mm thick, with reinforced meshes and embedded meshes in the plaster matrix.
    • The invention includes a building with a stucco wall of at least 2.4 m high, 4 m wide, and 21 mm thick, with reinforced meshes and embedded meshes in the plaster matrix.
    • The invention includes a building with a stucco wall of at least 2.4 m high, 4 m wide, and 21 mm thick, with reinforced meshes and embedded meshes in the plaster matrix.
    • The invention includes a building with a stucco wall of at least 2.4 m high, 4 m wide, and 21 mm thick, with reinforced meshes and embedded meshes in the plaster matrix.
    • The invention includes a building with a stucco wall of at least 2.4 m high, 4 m wide, and 21 mm thick, with reinforced meshes and embedded meshes in the plaster matrix.
    • The invention includes a building with a stucco wall of at least 2.4 m high, 4 m wide, and 21 mm thick, with reinforced meshes and embedded meshes in the plaster matrix.
    • The invention includes a building with a stucco wall of at least 2.4 m high, 4 m wide, and 21 mm

<summary>
* The invention relates to a new and improved safe structure for containing valuable papers and articles.
    * It features a valuables receiving chamber with a rectangular opening and inwardly extending ledges for placement of a steel door.
        * The door is secured in the chamber by grooves on the chamber walls, with one groove deeper than the other to accommodate the door's angled insertion.
        * A lock assembly on the door's reverse side prevents lateral movement and protects the lock mechanism from forceful intrusion attempts.
* The invention also provides a low-cost, readily assembled door and safe structure.
    * The construction can be formed using a liner and concrete, with the liner serving as both the form and the body of the safe.
        * The door is secured to the chamber walls by steel bar members, with the door's lower edge resting in a groove and the upper edge being pivoted toward a ledge.
        * The door can be easily assembled and attached to the safe structure, with the bar members being secured in place by bolts.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to improved methods and apparatus for measuring fluid pressures in geological formations, aiming to accurately measure pressures at a specific depth without interference from pressures at other depths.
    • It involves a system that isolates the pressure sensor from the entire borehole, only measuring the pressure of the formation at the desired depth.
    • The system includes a conduit with a filter at the bottom, connected to a pressure transducer via a check valve, and a pressure relief valve to prevent fluid backflow.
    • The conduit is pressurized with fluid to clear the filter of cement grout, and then additional fluid is pumped to displace the grout and establish a fluid connection with the formation.
    • The system can be installed in a single cementing operation and allows for the installation of multiple sensors.
    • It can be used in various embodiments, including permanent downhole pressure transducers and systems that allow for hydrofracture and relocation of the transducer.
    • The invention provides a more reliable connection between the pressure sensor and the formation, with the potential for remote monitoring and telemetry.
    • The invention addresses the need for accurate pressure measurement in geological formations for civil engineering, hydro-geology, and petroleum engineering applications.
    • The system can be adapted to different reservoir types and can be used for high accuracy monitoring of groundwater.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function, useful in new transit systems, monorails, road bridges, and footbridges.
    * It addresses issues with rubber and steel expansion joints, such as slip resistance, durability, and safety concerns.
    * The invention comprises a jointing structure with more than one elastic member and a joint block across the expansion gap.
    * The elastic members are made of laminated rubber, which deforms easily horizontally and resists vertical deformation.
    * The joint block, made of concrete or high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete, is detachable and can be easily maintained.
    * The structure allows for decentralizing the expansion gap, reducing the size of each individual expansion gap, and preventing tire fall-in and stuck-in situations.
    * The invention also includes methods for mounting the elastic members, which are designed to be unaffected by seasons, time of day, or bridge girder ages.
    * The elastic members can be joined and deformed using an oil hydraulic jack, and the joint block can be shifted to accommodate expansion or contraction of the bridge girders.
* The invention is adaptable for various tire configurations and ensures high slip resistance, reduced tire fall-in and stuck-in situations, and ease of maintenance.
    * The jointing structure can be further decentralized by adding intermediate joint blocks, and the expansion gaps can be made uniform by adjusting the shear modulus of the laminated rubber.
    * The invention also includes oblique expansion gaps to prevent tire fall-in and stuck-in situations in small-sized vehicles.
    * The jointing structure is designed to be robust, with the joint block and supporting blocks made of the same concrete as the traveling path, ensuring substantially the same wear development and preventing level differences.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a track transport system for use in fluid treatment chambers, particularly for moving wheeled trucks without contaminating the sanitary environment.
    * The system includes an enclosed floor track with a wheel channel above the fluid level, preventing brine solution contamination.
    * The wheel channel has a cover plate and sidewalls, with a hinge for easy cleaning.
* The system also features sidewalls extending upwardly beyond the wheel structure, with inflatable elastomer seals to prevent brine solution entry.
    * The seals are attached along the sidewall top edges and inflate to create a perfect seal around the wheel struts.
* The invention allows for the recovery and reuse of the brine solution, maintaining its sanitary nature without the need for decontamination.
    * The enclosed track system is adaptable for hand trucks with various wheel structures, including those with I-beam struts.
    * The inflatable seals act as a brake when compressed, preventing unintended movement of the trucks along the inclined track.
* The system is constructed with materials resistant to corrosion from the brine solution.
    * The clamps and seals are preferably made of stainless steel for durability and resistance to corrosion.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces a lock device for construction machines, particularly for preventing the rotation of a backhoe's boom.
    * The lock device features an engaging member with a hook and slot, and an engaged member with a hook part and a slanted surface.
    * The engaging member is supported by a guide member and a support pin, which prevents slippage and allows for easy manual operation.
    * The lock device can maintain its position even when the boom is rotated between its highest and lowest positions.
    * The device is designed to reduce the number of parts and assembly processes, thereby lowering costs and extending the life of the lock mechanism.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaner with an adjustable suction head for precise regulation of suction efficiency during cleaning.
    • The vacuum head features adjustable rollers connected to the platform, allowing for easy and quick regulation of suction without needing to adjust the pool's circulation pump.
    • Adjustment mechanisms are conveniently located on the top of the vacuum head and can be operated by hand without tools.
    • The invention can be added to existing pool cleaning devices with minor modifications, providing a simple and inexpensive solution for regulating suction.
    • The adjustment mechanism consists of a frame member connected to the vacuum head, with a connector, wing nut, and coil spring to adjust the roller height.
    • The invention includes a roller height adjustment device in kit form for use with prior art suction head assemblies, requiring minimal modification to existing devices.
    • The kit comprises a frame, connector, wing nut, coil spring, and four axles for precise adjustment of the inboard rollers.
    • Assembly of the kit to an existing suction head is simple, involving disconnecting the existing connector, removing the cover and weight, inserting the new connector, and adjusting the wing nuts.
    • The invention allows for precise suction regulation without the need for major retrofitting of existing devices.
    • The invention's design is simple, easy to use, and can be manufactured inexpensively.
    • The invention's novel adjustability feature enables quick and easy regulation of suction during pool cleaning operations.
    • The invention's design is suitable for commercial pool cleaning operators who need to clean multiple pools with varying suction capabilities.
    • The invention's design can be retrofitted to existing devices, providing a cost-effective solution for regulating suction.
    • The invention's design is user-friendly, requiring no specialized tools or extensive modifications.
    • The invention's design is durable, using materials like metal, rigid plastic, or other suitable, durable materials for construction.
    • The invention's design is versatile, applicable to various

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from oil well drilling operations.
    * The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel and retriever section for engaging and retrieving the wear bushing without the need for drill bit removal.
    * The apparatus allows for vertical movement to prevent damage from the weight of the drill string, while preventing rotational movement during operation.
    * The apparatus can be threadably engaged between drill pipe sections without retrieving the drill bit.
    * The apparatus can be easily removed and installed for quick retrieval of the wear bushing during drilling operations.
    * The apparatus can be adapted to retrieve the bushing by threading into the bushing.
* The apparatus comprises a sub-unit with a mandrel section and a retriever section.
    * The mandrel section has a longitudinal bore and threadable collars for engaging drill pipe sections.
    * The retriever section has a circular shape with a bore slightly larger than the mandrel section, allowing for sliding movement along the mandrel.
    * The retriever section has protruding members for engaging with a J-slot in the wear bushing and grooves on the mandrel for slidable vertical movement.
    * The apparatus can be threadably engaged between drill pipe sections and allows for vertical play during operation.
    * The apparatus can be adapted to retrieve the bushing by threading into the bushing.
* The apparatus is used during drilling to prevent wear bushing damage from the drill string's weight.
    * The apparatus is threadably attached to the drill string and lowered into the hole until it contacts the wear bushing.
    * The apparatus rotates to align the protruding members with the J-slot in the wear bushing, locking the retriever section in place.
    * The drill string is then backed up, and the wear bushing is retrieved from the hole.
    * The apparatus can be reused for retrieving a new wear bushing and replacing the old one.
* The apparatus can be adapted to retrieve different types of wear bushings.
    * An additional embodiment of the retriever section has

<summary>
   • The invention pertains to a downhole vibratory tool that selectively allows passage for other tools.
      • The tool features a reconfigured dump valve in an annular shape to prevent slamming against a seat during cycling.
      • A modular piston stack delivers increased power for more effective fish dislodgment.
      • The tool includes a simple, non-moving plug for activation and wireline access, enhancing reliability and reducing maintenance costs.
      • The tool can operate with or without impacts, controlled by the overpull applied to the string.
      • The tool's design allows for a longer power stroke and improved force application to the stuck object.
      • The tool can be used for various downhole operations, including stimulation and fishing, with a single valve for operation control.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a precast concrete retaining wall system that allows for taller walls and shorter bases by using pre-manufactured components.
        • The system comprises a precast face panel with an integral counterfort and a precast base.
            • The face panel can have surface ornamentation and multiple counterforts for support.
            • The counterfort extends rearward from the face panel and can have a flat bottom for drainage and reinforcement.
            • Reinforcing bars within the counterfort and base provide tensile strength and act as anchors.
            • The base can have openings for rebar ends and may include a shear key for connection.
    • The system allows for flexibility in installation and can be combined with various features for added stability.
        • Multiple retaining walls can be connected with shear keys or ship laps.
            • The base can be textured or have ports for grout to increase friction.
            • H-piles can be driven into the ground for added stability, with pockets or pile caps for grout filling.
            • Vehicle impact barriers can be integrated into the wall for safety.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to systems and methods for improving oil and gas well production by heating oil and paraffin at the down hole end of production tubing.
        • The invention addresses two primary shortcomings of conventional heating systems:
            • Focused heating on the production zone to improve flow.
            • Protection of electrical components from down hole fluids to prevent failures.
        • The invention has demonstrated significant increases in oil well flow rates compared to existing systems.
            • The invention provides a more effective and reliable down hole heating system.
            • The invention offers a method for heat treating wells to improve flow rates.
            • The invention can be adapted for use with wire line cables instead of down hole pipe.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, specifically for fishing operations in well bores.
  * The mechanism can take the form of an external pull tool or an internal spear, adaptable for use in well servicing operations.
  * It features an outer tubular body with an inner body structure that telescopes into gripping relationship with the object to be removed.
  * The tool structure includes a catch mechanism with a locking and unlocking position, controlled by a pin structure and a spring.
  * The mechanism can be unlocked and locked by simple linear movement of the tool, without the need for jarring or mechanical shocks.
  * The invention includes a collet type device for internal connection with the object and a spear slip structure for engagement with a standard fishing neck.
  * The mechanism allows for repeated latching and unlatching without the need for removal from the well bore.
  * The invention can be used with wire line controlled pulling tools and is adaptable for various down hole service operations.
  * The invention aims to reduce the expense and complexity of service operations by providing a simple and efficient tool for connection and disconnection.
  * The invention includes an adjustable spacer element for accurate positioning of the connection device with respect to the locking structure of various locking mandrels, pipes, etc.
  * The invention also includes a latching mechanism with guide pins and recesses for controlled movement and selective positioning of the tool.
  * The invention incorporates a compression spring and an annular sealing element for maintaining the inner body structure in an upward position relative to the outer housing.
  * The invention can be used with an overshot structure for engagement with a standard fishing neck, providing a gripping relationship with the shoulder surface of the fishing neck.
</summary>
