<summary>
* The invention relates to ladders, specifically attachments that position the ladder away from the work surface, preventing damage and improving stability.
    * The attachments feature an extension arm with a flange and U-bolt, securing the ladder to the work surface without causing harm.
    * The design allows the ladder to straddle corners, enhancing stability and accessibility.
* The invention aims to prevent the ladder from slipping or sliding, and to avoid defacing the work surface with the ladder's siderails.
    * The attachments increase the contact area between the ladder and the work surface, improving lateral stability.
* The invention includes a resilient pad assembly that grips the work surface without causing damage.
    * The design can be adjusted to accommodate different ladder sizes and can be used on both flat and corner surfaces.
* The invention is not limited to specific details and can be modified for various situations and materials.
    * The essential teachings of the invention are covered by the claims, which encompass various modifications and applications.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a collated fastener system that reduces debris and corrugation when driven into a substrate.
        • The system uses a plastic collation material that adheres to the fastener shanks, maintaining adhesion during driving.
            • The plastic material is molded onto the fasteners, forming a collar that encircles the shank and a connecting portion between adjacent fasteners.
            • The connecting portion includes a bridge and a rib, with a cruciform shape, to enhance rigidity and facilitate separation at a desired location.
            • The system can be configured with a preferentially weakened region to encourage separation at a specific location, reducing debris generation.
            • The fasteners can be positioned eccentrically or have deformations to improve penetration and reduce debris.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants, such as silicones, in various industrial applications, including automotive, aviation, naval, railway, and robotics.
        • The nozzle features a bell or hood-shaped lower section and an injection button with a special design for precise sealing operations.
        • The invention aims to provide a versatile, reusable, and efficient nozzle that improves sealing accuracy and can be used manually or with automated machines.
        • The nozzle is made of plastic, preferably polypropylene, and can be connected to sealant cartridges or injection machines via a threaded section.
        • The bell-shaped section encapsulates rivets or nuts, while the injection button, with its channels and orifices, allows for precise sealing around rivets and screws.
        • The nozzle simplifies sealing work, reduces application time, and increases the quality of the sealant application.
        • The invention includes various embodiments and variations, all within the scope of the appended claims.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to sensors, particularly position and motion sensors.
    * It aims to reduce the number of wires required for sensor systems, minimizing cost and weight.
    * The invention employs a method of multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with minimal energy required from each sensor monitoring system.
    * A sensor signal conditioner and remotely connected monitoring equipment are part of the invention.
* The invention includes a sensor that comprises a waveform generator and an error correction generator.
    * The waveform generator modifies the unconditioned sensing signal in response to an error correction signal to provide a conditioned sensing signal.
    * The error correction generator uses a comparator, controller, and signal processor to determine and eliminate strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver position information.
* The invention features a window reference circuit that compares the ideal sensor output to the existing sensor output and adjusts the output if it deviates from a preset reference.
    * The signal processor generates a reference signal that eliminates small values of drift and allows for rapid recalibration due to sudden changes in offset voltage.
* The invention's sensor modulates a current across two wires, converting it into a modulated sensor signal voltage.
    * Upon startup, the sensor draws a minimum of current due to a preset pulse that causes the counter and DAC outputs to their highest values.
    * The resistor connected to the sensor output converts the voltage to a current drawn through the sensor leads.
    * The invention allows for rapid recalibration and minimal energy consumption from the sensor monitoring system.
* The invention can be embodied in various forms and is not limited to the specific embodiments disclosed.
    * Modifications and embodiments are intended to be included within the scope of the appended claims.
* The invention is particularly relevant for monitoring mechanical systems with moving parts, such as internal combustion engines.
    * It addresses the need for efficient and safe operation of such systems by providing a method of monitoring position or movement with minimal wiring and energy requirements.
* The invention's error correction mechanism ensures that only relevant position information is transmitted, eliminating unnecessary power consumption and signal noise.
    * The invention's window reference circuit

<summary>
* The invention relates to valve action in internal combustion engines, specifically a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust functions.
  * The system aims to control valve port openness efficiently, enhancing engine performance and reducing gas consumption.
  * It eliminates the need for springs in valve operation, simplifying construction and operation.
  * The system allows for infinitely variable valve displacement, controlled by computer, to optimize engine performance and fuel economy.
  * The valve actuation system can be applied to engines with multiple valves per cylinder, such as four or six valves.
  * The invention includes a control mechanism that can adjust valve displacement for individual or collective cylinder operation.
  * The system is designed to be robust, simple, and precise, with potential for high-speed engine performance enhancement.
  * The invention claims priority from a provisional application filed in 2001.
* The invention's background highlights the limitations of standard camshaft and spring valve actuation systems, emphasizing the need for improved valve control.
  * The invention seeks to optimize valve operation for various engine speeds and conditions, including idle, acceleration, and cruising.
  * The system aims to reduce gas consumption by controlling valve port openness and allowing cylinder deactivation when necessary.
  * The invention provides a means for precise and timely valve control, improving engine performance and vehicle responsiveness.
  * The invention's preferred embodiment includes a variable displacement feature for intake valves, allowing for adjustable port openings.
  * The system can be integrated with existing engine designs, offering a simpler and more efficient alternative to current valve actuation methods.
* The detailed description outlines the kinematics of the valve actuation system, demonstrating its springless operation and variable displacement capabilities.
  * The system includes a control block that adjusts the valve displacement while maintaining the valve in the closed position during operation.
  * The invention can be applied to engines with multiple valves per cylinder, with the potential for centralized control of valve actuation.
  * The system's design allows for easy manufacturing, assembly, and installation compared

<summary>
     • The invention relates to LED aquarium lighting systems that offer manual and remote control over light color and intensity.
         • The system includes a housing with a top and bottom side, a lighting control region, and switches for controlling light channels.
         • The lighting control region can accommodate multiple light-emitting modules, each with specific color outputs and connectors.
         • The system allows for adjustable color temperature output and can include RGB LEDs for a wide range of colors.
         • The modules can be installed in series under cabinets and controlled by timers or remote controls for automated lighting schedules.
         • The invention can be adapted for use with various enclosures, not limited to aquariums, and includes features like optical elements and heat sinks for enhanced lighting effects.
         • The system is designed to be compact and user-friendly, with modules that can only be installed in one orientation.
         • The invention provides a versatile and customizable lighting solution for aquariums and other enclosures.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces a cooled flow deflection apparatus for high-temperature fluid-flow machines, aiming to address the disadvantages of current cast separating walls in gas turbine blades.
  * The separating walls are constructed as separate inserts rather than being cast, allowing for simpler production, reduced weight, and easier cooling system adjustments.
  * The inserts are secured within the apparatus using holders or integral material joints, with the option of soldering or welding for a secure seating.
  * The invention offers flexibility in the design of the separating walls, including the possibility of U-shaped inserts for connecting adjacent cooling channels.
  * The invention simplifies assembly and provides advantages such as reduced thermal stresses and centrifugal-force stresses, especially beneficial for high-speed rotor blades.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a system and method for controlling a fuel delivery system in vehicles, allowing for smooth transition between automatic and manual control without causing the vehicle to lurch or stall.
        • The system comprises a control unit that processes signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve position to set the throttle position for optimum performance.
        • The control unit also provides an output signal to control a clutch, which connects the accelerator pedal directly to the throttle valve during manual control.
    • The invention allows for the system to be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission, preferring manual control at low ratios and automatic control at high ratios.
        • The system can automatically switch to manual control in case of a malfunction, ensuring full vehicle operation and safety.
        • The system can also switch from manual to automatic control, with the transition being smooth and without causing the vehicle to lurch or stall.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a waste fuel burner that minimizes particulate emissions and efficiently burns wood waste.
        • It achieves this by forming a conical pile of waste fuel and introducing preheated underfire air to dry and gasify the fuel, followed by tangential swirl air for initial combustion and secondary air for complete combustion.
        • The system is self-regulating, easy to control, and has fast response times to changes in load.
        • It can handle wet wood of up to 70% moisture content and produces minimal slag or clinkers.
    • The burner can be adapted to various sources of dirty particulate-laden combustible gases, not just wood waste.
        • The primary and secondary combustion chambers can be added to any such source to burn the gases and remove particulate matter.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to the field of evaporative refrigeration, specifically air conditioning.
    * It introduces a highly efficient evaporative cooling apparatus that separates evaporating water from the useful air, avoiding the addition of water vapor to the air.
    * The system recirculates a major portion of the working air from the room to be cooled, utilizing its lower wet bulb temperature for greater cooling efficiency.
* The apparatus features a heat exchanger with a dry side for cooling fresh air and a wet side for evaporating water, with countercurrent flow of air and water for optimal heat transfer.
    * The design allows for additional efficiency through heat exchange with fresh air or a vapor compression refrigeration system, and can be adapted for specific climatic conditions or high cooling rate usage.
* The invention includes a hybrid system that integrates a vapor compression refrigeration unit, further enhancing cooling and dehumidification capabilities.
    * The hybrid system cools a minor portion of the air stream with the evaporator of a vapor compression unit, improving overall efficiency and reducing energy consumption.
</summary>

<summary>
* Fluid pump with multiple pump heads in series for high flow rate and pressure
    * Pump heads contain housings with impellers and drive shafts
    * Drive shafts are connected through connectors, allowing common driving of impellers
* Fluid flow paths are designed to combine flow from multiple conduits into a single flow
    * Connectors may be removable or integral, and may extend through pump heads
* Support structures include wheeled booms, hitching assemblies, and trailers
    * Pumps can be mounted on these structures for operation at fluid reservoirs
* Impellers have arcuate vanes for efficient fluid movement
    * Drive shafts are frictionally secured within connectors to prevent corrosion and facilitate maintenance
* Pump assembly can be modular, allowing for easy repair and addition of more pump heads
</summary>

<summary>
    • Engine includes a plurality of engine cylinders with a modular engine compression release brake system for less than all cylinders.
        • Engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve.
            • Brake body includes a biasing spring, coil, and armature.
            • Spool valve member defines high and low pressure annuli and controls fluid flow.
            • Hydraulic surface in brake body is exposed to fluid pressure for actuation.
    • Method of engine braking uses less than all engine cylinders, controlled by an electronic module.
            • Engine brake is activated during compression stroke for engine braking.
            • Actuation fluid passage is blocked from low pressure passage and opened to high pressure passage for engine braking.
            • Piston advances to vent compressed air via exhaust valve actuator.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mounting link assembly between an engine and an auxiliary gearbox, designed to withstand extreme loads such as blade-off events in gas turbine engines.
    • The assembly includes a male link coupled to one component, a female link coupled to the other component, and a pin releasably coupled to both links.
    • The radial interface formed by the female and male links dampens relative translation, providing coulomb damping to absorb shocks.
    • The pin can shear under extreme loads, allowing the links to translate without transmitting destructive loads.
    • The snap ring limits the travel of the male link after the pin shears, preventing separation of the assembly.
    • The invention allows for maintenance and replacement of the pin without needing to replace the entire assembly.
    • The invention obviates the need for all linkages and connections to withstand extreme loads, reducing weight and material requirements.
    • The invention is not limited to the described embodiments and can include various modifications and alterations.
    • The invention is particularly useful for aircraft gas turbine engines and their auxiliary gearboxes.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for small arms training.
        • It simulates small arms fire without modifying the weapon or using mechanical actuation, except in electrical switches.
            • The simulator uses a low-cost plastic expendable housing and a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic, with an electrical ignition system.
            • It produces sound and flash by electrically igniting the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion through the weapon's ejection port.
            • The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire, and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt.
    • The invention offers several advantages, including realistic simulation of small arms fire, cost-effectiveness, and low maintenance.
            • It provides a reliable, inexpensive, and reusable small arms training device.
            • It simulates small arms fire without dangerous pressurization of the ignition chamber.
    • The invention is packaged to resemble the magazine clip of an M16 rifle, enhancing realism in training.
            • The expendable is designed for automatic fabrication to reduce cost.
            • Each pyrotechnic charge is a shaped pellet composed of specific proportions of potassium perchlorate, black powdered aluminum, and dextrose, sealed within a plastic cup.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a two-part bracket for mounting speakers or other equipment to various surfaces, simplifying installation and allowing for directional positioning.
        • The stationary bracket is mounted on a surface and the adjustable bracket is attached to the object to be mounted.
            • Tapered springs guide the brackets together, and the adjustable bracket is rotated into a locked position using integrated hooks and tabs.
            • Two axel screws are inserted to form a hinge, allowing for vertical adjustment.
            • The system is designed for one-person installation and is suitable for outdoor use.
    • The bracket assembly includes a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, with the latter being positioned on the stationary bracket to mount the object.
            • The adjustable bracket has a slit and flexible wings, with tabs and hooks for engagement with the stationary bracket.
            • The final position is secured with screws, providing a stable and adjustable mounting solution.
    • The pole mounting bracket includes adapter brackets with stepped teeth for various pole sizes and a chain and wing nuts for securing the assembly to the pole.
            • The system allows for 360 degrees of horizontal adjustment and is resistant to rotation and slippage.
            • The entire bracket assembly can be easily connected to a speaker and mounted on a pole, with the ability to adjust the speaker's position as needed.
    • The invention provides a simple, efficient, and robust solution for mounting speakers and other equipment, with minimal components and no need for tools.
            • The design is suitable for loudspeakers, lighting, signage, displays, monitors, video cameras, etc., and can be used on walls without pole adapters.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a combustion apparatus and a system of interchangeable heat utilizing appliances.
        • The burner features a combustion chamber with an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, facilitating initial and secondary combustion, and a shroud for tertiary combustion air and safety.
        • The burner includes legs for stability, an ash pan for ember extinguishment, a cover for safety, and a pivotally coupled perforate food grate for modular appliance attachment.
        • The burner can be coupled to various modular heat utilizing appliances, including cookers, smokers, space heaters, and pyrolyzers, with manual couplings.
        • The system optimizes efficiency and minimizes unburned fuel emissions, with the capability for continuous operation and fuel renewal.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention aims to improve ignition and cooling systems in rotary internal combustion engines to maintain efficient combustion and reduce structural failure risks.
  * It introduces a housing structure that enhances circumferential cooling flow and minimizes thermal distortion around spark plug bosses.
    * The design features staggered spark plug bosses in a circumferential cooling flow passageway, offset from a centerline to promote a controlled flow regime and prevent vapor film formation.
    * Flow diverters or flow controllers are used between the bosses to ensure a controlled flow regime and reinforce the housing structure.
* The invention seeks to increase the heat transfer coefficient at the spark plug boss zone by at least 20% over prior art capabilities.
  * The staggered arrangement of the bosses allows for high heat transfer coefficients by maintaining a high velocity, controlled flow and avoiding uncontrolled swirling eddies.
    * The offset of the spark plug terminals is crucial for achieving the desired heat transfer coefficient and should be less than the radius of a boss.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method of minimizing flow disturbance in turbines during periodic operational testing of control valves.
    * It utilizes control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant total mass flow through parallel turbine inlet flow control valves.
    * This method ensures the steam generator pressure remains constant and the inlet pressure regulator is unaffected during inlet control valve testing.
    * The flow is determined as a function of control valve position, and the flow characteristic for each valve of the system with N valves and with N-1 valves is determined during the turbine design process.
    * The invention includes a test compensation circuit that uses control valve positions as feedback to adjust the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closure and reopening of a turbine control valve during testing.
    * The invention has been demonstrated to reduce the pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main steam pressure by 95% in a simulated system.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus with two fluid inlets and one outlet, allowing a solution ranging from 0% inlet A fluid to 100% inlet B fluid.
    * The valve comprises a valve body, two inlet passages, an outlet passage, and an adjustable valve mechanism.
        * The valve body defines a bore for the first inlet passage and a larger bore for the second inlet passage.
        * The first inlet passage receives a fluid (e.g., soap solution) at a predetermined pressure, while the second inlet passage receives another fluid (e.g., water) at a different predetermined pressure.
        * The outlet passage provides a proportional mixture of the two fluids.
        * The valve mechanism allows the mixture to range from about 0% first fluid to about 100% second fluid.
* The valve system includes a flow restricting device to reduce the flow rate of the first fluid and a cylindrical bore to reduce the flow rate of the second fluid.
    * The flow restricting device is typically a screw made from stainless steel with a bore diameter of approximately 0.052 inches.
    * The cylindrical bore is sized to be slightly smaller than the bore diameter of the first inlet passage.
    * The valve body is made from a material such as 304 stainless steel.
* The valve includes a sealing sleeve made of TEFLON® to retain the seal carrier on the valve.
    * The seal carrier has a bore sized to fit the cylindrical portion of the valve and a boss to compress the sleeve against the valve walls.
    * The seal carrier also defines a channel for retaining a fluid seal ring.
* The valve has a series of cylindrical spools and channels to retain the fluid seal ring and allow for proportional mixing of the fluids.
    * The spools and channels are slidably received within the valve body.
    * The valve can be adjusted by rotating an adjustment handle to vary the proportion of the fluids in the outlet mixture.
* The valve system

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and arrangement for compressing and cooling gas in a compressor station for gas pipelines, particularly in permanent frost areas, to reduce investment and operation risks.
    • The method involves compressing gas to an excess pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and expanding it to the desired exit pressure.
    • The arrangement includes at least one compressor, heat exchanger, valve-controlled pipelines, and control units for compressor and valve operation.
    • An electronic control system operates the compressor to achieve excess pressure and expands the gas to the desired exit pressure.
    • The invention utilizes the cooling effect of gas expansion to reduce the need for separate re-cooling plants, especially during warm periods.
    • The method allows for the recovery of mechanical energy during gas expansion, which can be used to drive the compressors.
    • The invention features a two-stage primary compression with a booster compressor and an expansion turbine for energy recovery.
    • The compressors can be exchanged as long as they operate at the same pressure, providing flexibility and cost savings.
    • The invention offers advantages throughout the year, including lower energy consumption and reduced risk of accidents due to the absence of re-cooling units.
    • The invention can be modified within the scope of the appended patent claims.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a cooling fan assembly system that eliminates the need for traditional fasteners like screws and rivets used to secure cooling fans to enclosures.
	• The system is applicable in various industries where forced air movement is used for temperature control.
	• The cooling fan assembly includes a motor that rotates a fan blade to move air from the enclosure interior to the exterior.
		• The motor can be an electrical motor, hydraulic motor, pneumatic motor, or other types of motors.
		• Motor control components can be mounted on or about the motor or separately, depending on the motor type.
	• The fan assembly includes a non-rotatable housing and a motor carrier with resilient legs that compress against a panel to secure the assembly.
		• The resilient legs have a compression gap and a spring mechanism to prevent disengagement and reduce vibrational noise.
		• The assembly is installed by inserting the turned-out portions of the legs into enlarged openings on the panel and then applying a combined compressive and rotating force to fully seat the assembly.
		• The fully installed position has the resilient legs spring outwardly into smaller openings, securing the assembly in place.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces kinematic mounts with novel damping features to protect instruments from damaging flight loads.
  * Damping materials are incorporated into the mounts to introduce a damping mechanism that dissipates vibration energy as heat.
  * The damping mechanism is designed to be frequency and temperature dependent, providing significant damping at launch frequencies while being negligible at low frequencies encountered in orbit.
  * The invention can be applied to a wide range of precision instruments where alignment stability is crucial.
* The invention modifies existing kinematic mount designs by adding vibration damping materials at flexural hinge locations.
  * Two embodiments of damper designs are presented: a spherical damper and a cylindrical slot damper, both utilizing viscoelastic materials.
  * The spherical damper uses a partial shell design to induce shearing deformation, while the cylindrical slot damper uses o-rings in slots to induce compression/tension.
* The invention aims to achieve modal damping values from 5-17% of critical damping, which is a significant improvement over existing designs.
  * The damping performance can be tailored by selecting appropriate viscoelastic materials with specific shear modulus, material loss factor, and thickness.
  * The invention also offers a simplified manufacturing process by using six identical strut elements, reducing complexity and costs.
* The invention provides a kinematic mounting scheme that can uncouple the instrument's suspension vibration modes, improving performance for instruments with rotating parts.
  * The proposed mounting scheme can be arranged in various configurations, including a classical arrangement pattern shown in the invention.
* The invention enables the use of damped kinematic mounts in space applications, providing significant performance improvements over non-damped mounts.
  * The invention can be adapted to various instruments and applications, with the potential for further optimization and customization.
* The invention has been described with reference to various illustrative embodiments, allowing for flexibility and equivalents without departing from the true spirit and scope of the invention.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to large size oil shear type clutch units, particularly for aircraft catapult systems, with interleaved clutch plates and discs.
  * It aims to overcome disadvantages of previous constructions, especially for large power transmission requirements.
  * The clutch unit features hydraulic fluid for retracting clutch plates to reduce residual drag and as a coolant for clutch discs.
  * It allows for easy replacement of clutch disc segments without complete disassembly.
* The clutch unit comprises an input shaft, an output shaft, clutch plates, clutch discs, and separate means for closing the gap between plates and discs.
  * The piston and cylinder means for each disc segment minimize residual drag, and auxiliary fluid pressure control means act as a coolant.
  * Clutch discs are segmented and mounted on shafts, allowing for individual segment replacement.
* The invention provides improved cooling, torque control, and reduced residual drag, with convenient inspection and maintenance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an internal combustion engine system that incorporates downstream expansion cylinders associated with a combustion cylinder to significantly lower the temperature of fluids, potentially eliminating the need for a radiator.
* The system includes a water injection system that cools the exhaust gases and steam expansion, and a gearing system that optimizes the output of the combined engine.
* The invention also features a catalytic material placed on surfaces to catalytically convert impurities in the exhaust gases within the engine itself.
* A water recovery system is included to recycle water used in the expansion process, and the system is adaptable to various types of combustion cylinders and expansion cylinders.
* The invention aims to achieve high thermal-to-mechanical efficiencies and reduce exhaust emissions by using cascaded expansion cylinders and catalytic conversion within the engine.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method for fabricating steel plates with a precoat that prevents the formation of detrimental intermetallic areas during welding and heat treatment, enhancing mechanical strength and corrosion resistance.
    * The precoat consists of an intermetallic alloy layer in contact with the steel substrate, topped by a metal alloy layer.
    * A portion of the metal alloy layer is removed from the precoat on the plate's periphery, either by brushing or laser ablation, to avoid contamination during welding.
    * The width of the removed area is adjusted to prevent intermetallic alloy formation during welding and to ensure corrosion resistance after heat treatment.
    * The steel composition is tailored for specific mechanical properties, and the parts are used in automotive safety applications.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention is a novel SCADA system for remotely controlling mobile structures that recover energy from severe weather patterns.
        • It optimizes energy extraction by using an algorithm that considers weather observations and sensor data.
            • The algorithm adjusts the mobile structure's navigation based on wind and water velocity vectors.
            • It can be applied to various mobile structures, including sailing vessels and hydrokinetic turbines.
            • The system can operate unmanned, reducing risks to human crews in hazardous conditions.
        • The SCADA system includes servers that gather data from multiple sources, such as GPS, weather satellites, and NOAA's GIS.
            • The servers run HMI software applications that communicate with microprocessor systems on the mobile structure.
            • The system allows remote human interaction with mission-critical navigation plans through a GUI.
        • The invention is not limited to the Turbine-Integrated Hydrofoil system and can be used for any mobile system that extracts energy from weather patterns.
            • It can guide navigation past weather patterns for logistics purposes without optimizing energy extraction.
            • The system can be implemented using various communication methods, including satellite and wireless systems.
            • It includes redundant communication methods for reliability.
    • The system comprises control and communications microprocessors on the mobile structure and servers at a central service facility.
        • The microprocessors execute functions for inputting and outputting data to sensors and control circuits.
            • They include sensors for measuring variables like wind speed, turbine gate openness, and vessel stability.
            • They also include actuators for controlling rudder rotation, propeller rotation, and sail trim.
            • The system can be customized for different types of mobile structures and energy extraction methods.
        • The GUI allows remote human operators to interact with the SCADA system and adjust control settings.
            • It provides visual representations of the mobile structure's position, heading, velocity, and points of sail.
            • It also displays virtual reality representations of the vessel's attitude and surrounding environment.
            • It allows operators to manually override automatic control and select mission-critical navigation parameters.
    • The SCADA system uses a weather semivariogram to predict energy yields and

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage manufactured using a ring element composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined in the circumferential direction and welded together.
  * The flat material ring segments are cut from sheet metal and are configured to form a 120° ring segment, requiring only three weld points for assembly.
  * The ring segments can be punched out in succession from a strip material, allowing for a high material saving and a single-step cutting of circular arc-like edges and joint geometries.
* The invention also relates to a method for manufacturing such a rolling body guide cage, where the ring element is formed from flat material ring segments joined and welded in a production step before axial profiling.
  * The welding can be performed using laser welding or pressure welding, with the option to retain material accumulations for a stronger weld.
  * The method allows for the ring segments to be initially joined in a rotary plate and then moved into a welding station, with the possibility of joining them after punching or cutting.
  * The design of the weld connection points can be enhanced by forming beads on the material before welding, ensuring a complete filling of the weld seam without weakening.
* The invention is particularly advantageous for manufacturing rolling body guide cages with an internal diameter of more than 140 mm, as it significantly reduces the material waste associated with cutting.
  * The invention can be applied to both radial and axial bearing cages, with the potential for increased mechanical strength through additional wire ring elements.
  * The process is adaptable to various designs of ball bearings, with the possibility of joining ring segments after the insertion of balls in the case of groove ball bearings.
* The invention includes detailed drawings illustrating the ring element and the structure of the rolling body guide cage, showcasing the welding and forming techniques used.
  * The drawings also demonstrate alternative joint contours and methods for axial securing of the ring segments.
* The invention aims to reduce production costs and material waste in the manufacture of rolling body guide cages, with a focus on high-quality design and low-cost process engineering.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to methods and systems for enhancing customer service in telecommunications by acquiring precise location information for service locations and providing efficient routing directions for service technicians.
    * It involves requesting and obtaining latitude and longitude coordinates for a customer's service location, updating databases with this information, and using a global satellite positioning system for tracking and directing service technicians.
    * The system includes an input device for technicians, a technician server for data processing and routing, a GPS system for location tracking, and a mapping system for generating travel directions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields, using two sensors and a digital processor.
    * The system employs two real triaxial magnetic field sensors and three pairs of compensation coils, with the control unit processing the sensor signals and generating control signals for the coils.
    * The control unit uses a matrix multiplication algorithm to combine the sensor signals into a virtual sensor signal, which is then modified by a control algorithm to generate control signals for the coils.
    * The system can compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields, and includes a feedback system to minimize interference between two adjacent systems.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for investigating a biological sample using CARS microscopy, where a resonance signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering is sensed in image-producing fashion.
    • The method includes furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.
    • The invention aims to improve CARS microscopy by introducing resonance sites into samples that inherently lack them or have insufficiently localized or specific resonance sites.
    • Bioorthogonal reactions are used to introduce resonance sites into the sample without interfering with natural processes or causing cell damage.
    • The method allows for the selective accentuation of defined structures in a sample, enabling species-selective imaging without the need for additional tagging or dyes.
    • The invention is particularly suitable for tagging in biological samples, such as nerve tissue, and for purity checking in food chemistry.
    • The method can be used with both tunable and fixed-wavelength Stokes light beams, with the latter not requiring spectrum acquisition.
    • The invention provides a reproducible counter-stain for the non-resonant background, improving the reproducibility and quantitative conclusions of CARS methods.
    • The invention allows for the use of small molecules that can be introduced deep into tissue without steric hindrance, facilitating three-dimensional image production.
    • The invention is based on known bioorthogonal reactions, such as copper-free click chemistry, Diels-Alder reactions, and Staudinger ligation, which are bioorthogonal and proceed without cell-damaging effects.
    • The method involves two steps: equipping the sample with a bioorthogonal functional group and introducing a tagging substance with a complementary functional group.
    • The invention enables the detection of target sites in samples without negatively affecting ongoing biochemical processes.
    • The invention allows for the increase in specificity and scattering cross section when necessary, improving the method's applicability in complex substance mixtures.
    • The invention

<summary>
• The invention provides a system for assessing radiation therapy segmentations.
    • It compares segmentations from various sources, including manual and software-generated segmentations.
    • The comparison process uses electronic files in DICOM-RT Structure Set format.
• The system generates volume models from segmentation files and identifies common, missing, and extra volume elements.
    • It measures the conformance between volume models using a metric method that increases with the number of missing and extra volume elements.
• The system provides a graphical display to assist in evaluating segmentation quality.
    • Common volume elements are colored green, missing volume elements blue, and extra volume elements red.
• The system allows customization of the metric method for evaluating segmentation quality.
    • It includes parameters for forgiving small errors and penalizing large errors.
• The system can be used for training, evaluation, and product assessment purposes.
    • It can be used for periodic quality assurance of autosegmentation routines.
• The system can be used to assess changes in patient anatomy during radiation therapy.
    • It can be used to determine if a new treatment plan should be prepared based on anatomy changes.
• The system is intended to be adaptable and include modified forms within the scope of the claims.
    • It can be used for assessing anatomy auto-segmentation routines or systems.
• The system can be used for assessing anatomy auto-segmentation routines or systems against updated and new imaging technology.
    • It can be used for assessing anatomy auto-segmentation routines or systems prior to customer purchase or clinical application.
• The system can be used for assessing anatomy auto-segmentation routines or systems for training purposes.
    • It can be used for assessing anatomy auto-segmentation routines or systems for periodic quality assurance.
• The system can be used for assessing anatomy auto-segmentation routines or systems for product evaluation purposes.
    • It can be used for assessing anatomy auto-segmentation routines or systems for training purposes.
• The system can be used for assessing anatomy auto-segmentation routines or systems for periodic quality assurance.
    • It can be used for assessing anatom

<summary>
• The invention relates to a data processing system with improved apparatus for executing floating point operations.
	• It provides a technique for accelerating the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit.
	• The acceleration is achieved by using a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments.
	• The subset difference allows for the initiation of subtraction procedures before the complete difference between the exponent arguments is available.
• The invention reduces the number of steps in the effective subtraction operation, thereby accelerating its execution.
	• The subset difference is used to determine the difference in the operand fractions, which can be calculated without waiting for the complete difference between the exponent arguments.
• The invention identifies the correct final fraction result based on the subset difference, reducing the need for additional computation.
	• The final fraction result is either an operand fraction or a calculated quantity, depending on the subset difference.
• The invention's preferred embodiment includes a subtraction unit and detection logic unit that work together to determine the final fraction result.
	• The control signals from the detection logic unit determine the operand fractions used in the final fraction result calculation.
• The invention's operation is illustrated in a block diagram and detailed description, which includes various figures and steps.
	• The invention's scope is limited only by the claims, and variations are apparent to those skilled in the art.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a method and system for tracking specimens acquired from patients in medical facilities, reducing mislabeling and errors.
        • The method involves storing machine-readable codes on patient ID means, orders, specimen containers, and processing them to match and track specimens.
            • A unique patient barcode is generated and stored in a database, linked to the patient's information.
            • An order barcode is generated and stored, linked to the patient's barcode and the order details.
            • Specimen containers have unique barcodes, and upon matching the patient and order barcodes, the specimen is collected and stored in the database.
            • A signal is generated to collect the specimen, and a timer ensures the process is completed within a set time.
            • The system eliminates the need for vial labels and associated staff labor, reducing costs and errors.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device that provides verbal information to users, such as golfers, about the golf course parameters.
        • It uses GPS technology to measure distances and other factors, and voice recognition technology to accept and respond to voice commands.
        • The device can be incorporated into headgear like a golf hat or visor, and may also be used in other portable applications.
        • It can store and process user data to provide personalized golf strategy recommendations, and may include Bluetooth technology for data transfer and audio communication.
        • The device can record and transmit geographic coordinates of a golf course, facilitating the calculation of distances and providing advice based on the user's past performance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to semiconductor design technology, specifically systems and techniques for implementing circuit designs into silicon-based integrated circuits (ICs).
    * It addresses the challenges of verifying integrated circuit designs that include both memory and logic components, which have different sizing, performance, and scaling issues.
    * The invention provides a system and method for checking design rules that accurately reports errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, such as memory and logic.
    * It eliminates false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules supported by the tool.
    * The invention also creates customized rules appropriate for different types of memory regions, based on modifying standard logic rules to accommodate the more liberal values available for memory regions.
    * The system and method can be executed on any number of conventional computing systems and are configured with the customized design rules and programs.
* The invention ensures that all types of memory regions fulfill their respective memory rules, and that all logic regions fulfill both logic and memory rules.
    * The process is more reliable and efficient than prior art techniques, as it avoids false errors and expedites the implementation of circuit designs into silicon form.
    * The invention can be applied to any mask pattern database, including those with no memory blocks or multiple types of memory blocks.
    * The invention can benefit other industries, such as LCD manufacturing, that require different design rules for different regions on a substrate.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to the use of waveguide holograms for controlled illumination of objects with specific requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators.
    • Waveguide holograms (WGHs) are thin substrate waveguides that allow for high diffraction efficiencies and uniform illumination.
    • WGHs can be used to replace bulky conventional illumination systems, offering compact and rugged arrangements with reduced reflection losses.
    • The active volume of a WGH illuminator is significantly smaller than that of conventional lens systems, leading to a substantial gain in space efficiency.
    • WGHs can achieve high diffraction efficiencies, with the potential for efficiencies approaching 1.
    • WGHs provide ideal illumination by preventing stray light from entering the observer's space due to total internal reflection.
    • Challenges with WGHs include alignment sensitivity, nonuniformity of the diffracted wavefront, and the potential for light dispersion.
    • Solutions to these challenges include careful alignment, recording holograms non-uniformly, and using waveguide properties for spectral selectivity.
    • The invention has been disclosed with reference to generic description and specific embodiments, with the examples not intended to be limiting.
    • The invention is supported by the U.S. government and incorporates the disclosure of a prior application.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a non-destructive testing method and apparatus for dynamoelectric machine rotors, specifically squirrel cage rotors in induction motors.
    • The apparatus includes a test head that allows for relative angular movement between the rotor and test head, with exciting means to magnetize the rotor and voltage and current sensing means to generate signals responsive to the rotor's magnetic flux variations.
    • The apparatus also includes skew sensing means to sense the rotor's effective electrical skew and generate a corresponding signal.
    • The processing means uses the signals to determine the rotor's resistance, reactance, and effective skew.
    • The apparatus provides automatic pass/fail determinations based on the calculated values compared to predetermined thresholds.
    • The apparatus includes a data acquisition, processing, and control system that controls the rotor test sequence and processes the acquired data.
    • The apparatus can store statistical information for analysis over multiple tests.
    • The apparatus is designed for efficient testing with a dual fixture system, allowing simultaneous setup of multiple rotors.
    • The invention is adaptable to various embodiments and modifications within its scope.
</summary>

<summary>
* The disclosure provides a method for securing mobile devices by granting managed libraries access to native resources based on validated digital certificates, while denying managed applications the same access.
    * The method includes a manager that validates digital certificates and authorizes requests for native resource access through managed libraries.
    * The manager can be effectuated by native instructions and can enforce access control based on the certificate information.
* The disclosure also includes a method for receiving and processing requests from managed applications to access native system resources through managed libraries.
    * The manager authorizes requests based on the validated digital certificates and can send requests to a runtime host for resource access.
* The disclosure further includes a method for verifying managed metadata associated with executables to ensure type safety and secure resource access.
    * The verification process involves inspecting managed metadata at runtime to confirm the integrity and safety of the executable code.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip.
    * The card features two protective, non-rigid layers laminated onto rigid outer layers.
    * The internal components are protected from damage, reducing production costs and increasing durability.
* The card uses a silica-filled polyolefin core layer with an adhesive layer to encase the antenna and chip.
    * Alkyd resin spids with anti-binding agents are printed on the core layer to minimize damage to electronic components.
    * Antennae and IC chips are attached to the core layer, with recesses cut in the adhesive layer to accommodate the chips.
* Two transparent polymer layers are affixed to the core and bottom layers for mechanical strength and image reception.
    * The image-receiving layers can be formed by dye diffusion thermal transfer or inkjet printing.
    * Protective layers can include security features like low cohesivity polymers or UV-sensitive inks.
* The card can be personalized with an inkjet printer before adding the protective layers.
    * The card can be laminated using a nip-roll lamination process.
    * The card can be imprinted with personal information and security features.
* The invention offers significant improvements in durability and ease of manufacture compared to prior art cards.
    * The card structure allows for various personalization and security features.
    * The invention is not limited to specific embodiments and can be adapted to various applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved implementation of a FIFO queue in a memory, specifically for functional memories, using a tree-shaped structure.
    * The tree-shaped structure comprises nodes with a maximum size and maintains a balance condition where all leaf nodes are at the same level and internal nodes are full except for those on the edges.
    * Additions and deletions are directed to maintain the leaf nodes at the same hierarchy level, with new nodes created as necessary.
    * Updates in the functional environment require logarithmic time and space, copying only the path from the root to the point of updating.
* The invention also includes a header node with three elements, which facilitates faster and less space-consuming updates.
    * The header node can be inverted in constant time and space, with an identifier indicating the beginning and end of the queue.
    * The invention allows for the queue to be used as a double-ended queue (deque), with the ability to add to both ends and delete from both ends.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to EPROM devices that can be manufactured using existing DRAM technologies, offering several advantages over current art EPROM devices.
        • It allows for the co-manufacture of EPROM and DRAM devices on the same wafer without additional costs.
        • The EPROM devices have larger coupling capacitors and higher gate coupling ratios, resulting in lower operation voltages and simplified circuit requirements.
    • The invention also includes methods to create EPROM devices using standard logic technologies without the need for high voltages.
        • It utilizes existing circuit elements, such as DRAM storage capacitors and transistor properties under stress conditions, to build EPROM devices.
        • The invention introduces "stress effect programmable read only memory" (SEPROM) devices that use transistor damages from electrical stresses to store data, ideal for embedded applications and security purposes.
        • SEPROM devices can be manufactured by any IC technologies and are cost-effective for storing large amounts of data.
        • However, they have limitations such as longer write times and non-reprogrammability due to accumulative stress damage.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a method for determining feedback gains in control systems, such as automatic guidance vehicles, to achieve optimal control characteristics.
  * The method involves iterative steps of provisionally determining feedback gains, executing control, evaluating control performance, and adjusting feedback gains based on performance.
    * Evaluation functions are used to assess the influence of each gain on control stability, accuracy, and response.
      * The method can quickly and accurately determine optimum feedback gains without complex analytic processes.
      * The invention is applicable to various types of feedback gains and control systems, and the order of determining gains can be varied.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and minimized size, suitable for cameras and video cameras.
  * The invention addresses the demand for zoom lenses that balance high relative aperture with reduced bulk and size, preserving optical performance.
  * The invention is particularly relevant for video cameras, which require high relative apertures due to low image pickup element sensitivity.
  * The invention aims to reduce the size of the zoom lens system while maintaining high optical performance across the zooming range.
  * The zoom lens comprises multiple lens units with specific refractive powers and curvatures to correct aberrations and achieve the desired zoom ratio.
  * The invention sets forth conditions for the construction and arrangement of the lens elements to ensure good aberration correction throughout the zooming range.
  * The invention achieves a reduction in the total length of the lens system, with a range of 9.13φ A to 9.19φ A.
  * The invention corrects residual aberrations, such as spherical aberration and coma, by designing the fourth and fifth lens units in specific forms.
  * The invention provides a large relative aperture, high zoom ratio, and standard image angle at the wide angle end in a compact lens system.
  * The invention is an advancement in reducing the size of zoom lenses while preserving high optical performance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, and photons, in a detector.
  * The method and device allow for both the detection of individual particles and the integration of count rates without prior knowledge of expected signal rates.
  * Discharging of a charge pulse or signal from the detector is performed on the low-voltage side, simplifying the distinction of small-size signals and avoiding excessive noise.
  * Individual signals are amplified in a fast amplifier, while signals are integrated in a slow amplifier upon exceeding a threshold value of the rate of the signals.
  * Separation of signals as a function of the rate is achieved using capacitors and inductors preceding the amplifiers.
  * The detector material can be doped or coated with a converter material for detecting uncharged particles.
  * Fast charge transport at room temperature, such as in diamond, is used for detecting particles over wide ranges of signal rates.
  * The invention is applicable in particle accelerators, reactor installations, diagnostic devices, and medical technology.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies in clutches.
        • The apparatus includes an enclosure with stationary and movable rings for mounting the disc assembly.
        • A torque motor and servo motor are used to apply and control torque, respectively.
        • An electronic sensor measures the distance between the rings, and a difference in this distance indicates the amount of warpage.
        • The apparatus operates automatically without manual intervention and provides external indications of test results.
        • The apparatus can store measurements for statistical process control.
        • The invention can be practiced in ways not specifically illustrated without departing from its spirit or scope.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to methods, systems, and software for face age-estimation.
    * It utilizes a contourlet appearance model (CAM) to extract facial features and classify faces into age groups.
    * Two aging functions are constructed to represent different aging mechanisms for youth and adults.
    * An age classifier is trained to distinguish between youth and adults.
    * The face age-estimation system uses the appropriate aging function based on the classified age group.
    * The system can be implemented on various computing devices and includes a feature extractor, mapping unit, classifier, and contourlet appearance model processor.
    * The system can receive image data in various formats and store it in a suitable computer storage system.
    * The system can be used in real-time applications and does not require user cooperation.
    * The invention has been supported by the U.S. Army Research Office and may have government rights.
    * The invention can be used in various applications such as surveillance systems, business management, and homeland security.
    * The invention can be implemented on a computing system that includes a processor, memory, input device, video display adapter, and peripheral output devices.
    * The system can communicate with a network and store instructions and data on a machine-readable storage medium.
* The invention aims to improve verification rates for image-based face age-estimation by addressing the challenges of face aging.
    * It considers both shape and texture variations in the aging process.
    * It uses a combination of statistical PCA and support vector regression to build aging functions and an age classifier.
    * It can be used to estimate the age of a person represented in an image and provide the estimated age as a single age or a set of ages with confidence factors.
    * The system can be pre-processed to generate aging functions and age classifier for a database of landmarked faces.
    * The system can be used to estimate the age of a person in real-time applications and does not require user cooperation.
    * The invention has potential applications in various fields such as surveillance systems, business management, and homeland security.
* The invention has been supported by the U.S. Army Research

<summary>
* The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, preserving the definition of the higher definition image.
    * The device comprises a controller for producing display light intensity signals for each pixel and a matrix of pixels organized in identical arrangements.
        * Each arrangement can be a square of four pixels, with dedicated pixels for each image and a remaining pixel for a combination of the two images.
            * The controller can apply attenuation functions to the signals based on predetermined threshold values.
                * The attenuation function can be exponential or linear, depending on the embodiment.
                * The parameters for the attenuation function can be set by the controller.
                * The attenuation function can also be applied to the second image pixels if their intensity signals are below a threshold.
    * The device can include two controllers, one for each image.
        * The controllers can generate video streams with different definitions and refresh frequencies.
            * The matrix can be formed by pixels emitting different colors, associated with dedicated filters.
                * The pixels can emit a single color or two colors that combine to restore the color of the first image.
                * The matrix can display a plurality of combined images with dedicated pixels for each image.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for activating a motor vehicle's security system, which includes a payment element that can be removed for transactions.
    * The mobile identification transmitter has a housing with a receptacle for the payment element, which can be locked in a secure state to prevent unauthorized use.
    * The payment element can perform financial transactions and communicate with a payment system, with the ability to execute cashless payments at a POS.
    * The communication between the payment element and the payment system is secure, using cryptographic methods and a short range, and can occur via Bluetooth or NFC.
    * The mobile identification transmitter can include an energy storage device for powering the electronics and payment element, with a redundancy for added reliability.
    * The housing can include a closure that seals the receptacle when the payment element is removed, and can be designed as a dummy plug for secure attachment.
* The invention also allows for the payment element to be integrated into a carrier that fits the receptacle's geometry, providing a housing function and secure storage.
    * The carrier can be removed or inserted by the user, and can be designed with its own communication means for the payment system.
    * The communication means can serve dual purposes, for both the security system and the payment system, enhancing convenience and functionality.
* The mobile identification transmitter can be compact and include a closure that pivots to seal the receptacle when the payment element is removed, ensuring protection of the electronics and payment element.
    * The invention provides for a secure, cashless payment system that can be used at POS, with transaction methods that can be online or offline, and requires user authentication.
* The mobile identification transmitter can be designed with a range of less than 20 cm for communication with the payment system, and can use a frequency range of approx. 13.56 MHz for high data transmission rates.
    * The communication between the payment element and the payment system can be carried out via Bluetooth or NFC, with the added security of cryptographic communication.
</summary>

<summary>
* The disclosed embodiments address issues related to the tribo charge of toner in imaging devices, such as printers and copiers, which can decrease during periods of inactivity, affecting image quality.
    * An intelligent method for controlling the tribo charge of toner is proposed, which includes determining periods of inactivity, measuring toner charge levels, and adjusting the toner charge based on the determined inactivity and measured charge levels.
        * The method uses a power law to approximate the decay of tribo charge during inactivity and includes a user usage pattern determining section that adapts to user behavior.
            * The method also predicts the next user usage and calculates the decay of tribo charge based on the inactivity period.
            * A charging section adjusts the toner charge to a predetermined level suitable for normal operation, and a performing section pre-runs the machine to ensure adequate charge level for printing.
            * The method can be implemented in software or hardware and can be combined with other features and functions for various applications.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a recording/reproducing apparatus with high precision control of multiple magneto resistive (MR) heads mounted on a rotary drum.
    • It allows for independent and precise regulation of bias currents to each MR head using a single control signal channel.
    • The control signals include data for regenerative amplifier operation and recording current settings.
• The apparatus employs a control signal generator on the stationary side and a decoder circuit on the rotary side to manage the bias currents and other control functions.
    • The control signals are transmitted over a single channel of a rotary transformer, enabling high precision control even with an increased number of MR heads.
• The invention also facilitates high-speed switching between MR heads and recording heads, with priority given to head switching data during transmission.
    • This ensures stable data recording and reproduction by preventing delays in head switching.
    • The invention can be applied to both digital and frequency-modulated analog signal transmission, and is not limited to MR heads or integrated circuits.
• Various embodiments of the invention are provided, including different configurations of MR heads, recording heads, and control circuits.
    • These configurations allow for optimized bias current regulation relative to recording characteristics and minimize heat generation from recording heads.
    • The invention can be effectively applied to both rotary and disk magnetic head type apparatuses.
• The invention can be modified within its scope, and the following claims are made to define its scope.
    • The invention relates to a recording/reproducing apparatus with high precision control of multiple MR heads.
    • It allows for independent and precise regulation of bias currents to each MR head using a single control signal channel.
    • The control signals include data for regenerative amplifier operation and recording current settings.
    • The apparatus employs a control signal generator on the stationary side and a decoder circuit on the rotary side to manage the bias currents and other control functions.
    • The control signals are transmitted over a single channel of a rotary transformer, enabling high precision control even with an increased number of MR heads.
    • The invention also facilitates high-speed switching between MR heads and recording heads, with priority given to
