<summary>
    • The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to provide hands-free automatic answering and communication.
        • It includes a selector switch for switching between conventional and automatic answering modes.
        • A timer controls the duration of automatic answering, which can be bypassed for extended conversations.
        • The invention aims to provide a simplified, portable, and versatile automatic answering service with minimal components for safety, reliability, and low cost.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to optical fiber communications, specifically in system network design and incorporation of branch powered amplification.
    • It aims to reduce or eliminate undersea optical repeaters by using remotely pumped optical amplifiers powered by branch cables.
    • The system includes a trunk and branch ring network with hubs and cable stations for signal routing and amplification.
    • Optical energy is transmitted unidirectionally over branch cables to power amplifiers, eliminating the need for additional fiber runs.
    • The system supports ring topology for network survivability, isolating only the cut branches without disrupting the entire network.
    • The invention can be applied to undersea and terrestrial communications systems, accommodating reconfigurable wavelength add/drop branching units.
    • It offers advantages such as maintaining full connectivity after trunk cuts, isolating only cut branches, respecting sovereignty concerns, and reducing capital and operational costs.
    • The invention utilizes a multiple order cascaded Raman laser for energy transmission, with wavelengths distinct from signal wavelengths.
    • The maximum effective distance between the energy source and amplifier is limited by current fiber attenuation rates, but may increase with advancements in technology.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices.
    * The device comprises two parts: an attachment member and a cover plate member.
        * The attachment member is installed over a wiring device and mounted to it using screws.
            * The attachment member contains latching pawls and a tab for prying off the cover plate.
            * The cover plate member has saw-tooth shaped racks to engage the latching pawls and a slot for a small tool to pry off the cover plate.
    * The cover plate member has apertures to receive the wiring device projections and a ridge to accommodate variations in wall flatness or evenness.
        * The device can be easily installed or removed using available fasteners and tools.
            * The device can be properly positioned over wiring devices installed in a wall that is not flat or even.
            * The device has no visible fasteners when installed.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for screens, aiming to improve upon existing designs.
    * The device features annular strips that are concentrically nested and enclosing, with a decreasing wall thickness in the axial direction.
    * This design allows the device to be folded around the screen, taking up minimal space and not obstructing viewing.
    * The device can be easily fitted to screens using Velcro and can be positioned at various angles.
    * It includes hook or locking elements for secure folding and an adapter member for flat attachment to monitors.
    * The invention aims to provide a cost-effective, reliable, and easily attachable light-shielding device with minimal parts.
* The invention is defined by the appended claims and includes various embodiments for improved positioning and attachment.
    * The device can be made from solid or bent plate material with integrated hooks and locking elements.
    * The profile sections of the strips show a decrease in thickness from the hook side to the other side, allowing for tight nesting and play when extended or slanted.
* The invention provides a solution to the disadvantages of previous designs, such as the need for a special fastening device, bulky size, and the requirement for the user to sit straight when the shielding device is extended.
    * The device's design allows for easy attachment to various monitor types and can be adjusted for viewing from different angles.
    * The invention is intended for a wide range of applications, including television sets and monitors.
* The invention's design is characterized by its simplicity, reliability, and adaptability to different screen types and viewing angles.
    * The device's construction minimizes production costs and enhances the user experience by providing a clear and adjustable viewing environment.
    * The invention's design also aims to improve the aesthetic appeal of the monitor housing by eliminating the need for a bulky and visually intrusive fastening device.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to automated speech technologies that provide feedback to speakers when their speaking rate may hinder listener comprehension.
    * It involves a system that monitors and compares the speaker's rate of speech to a listener's comprehension threshold, which can be adjusted based on language proficiency.
    * The system can include a wearable device or integrated into existing communication devices, with sensory mechanisms to alert the speaker to slow down or change language if necessary.
* The invention also encompasses methods and devices for facilitating understanding between discourse participants by automatically adjusting speaking rates and potentially suggesting language changes based on shared proficiency.
    * It can be implemented as a standalone device, networked device, or distributed system, with capabilities for speech processing, listener profiling, and communication over various network types.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a device for enhancing the optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, allowing for higher picture sequence frequencies.
        • The device includes means for deviating and suppressing the beam to make the scanning beam run over N lines of a picture plane successively and cyclically.
        • It comprises a cyclic line counter and a sawtooth generator synchronized with the counter's output pulses, which control the vertical deviation of the beam and the beam suppression circuit.
        • The line counter is preferably a programmable counter, allowing for selectable line scanning frequencies.
        • The device can be used with conventional TV cameras with slight modifications, enabling higher frame rates without increasing spatial resolution.
        • The invention is suitable for recording various types of images, including IR, UV, or X-ray pictures.
        • The device can be employed in conjunction with two TV camera systems for improved analysis capabilities.
        • Video signals can be digitized and stored for further analysis, with the option to interpolate missing lines.
        • The device allows for the recording of processes that previously required expensive film cameras, facilitating immediate computer analysis.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to multimedia communications, specifically handling multimedia calls with legacy phones and services.
    • It aims to integrate multimedia capabilities with existing circuit-switched and packet-switched calls without replacing legacy equipment.
    • The invention introduces a blended call concept, combining voice and multimedia components into a single session.
    • A multimedia server and a telephony server work together, with blender software managing the call components.
    • The invention uses SIP-T for call setup and teardown, and can also utilize Intelligent Network (IN) signals for call handling.
    • The invention supports various network systems and protocols, with an exemplary embodiment based on SIP.
    • It includes a communication environment with telephony and multimedia servers, client devices, and connections.
    • The invention allows for concurrent processing of voice and multimedia components, with control over signaling paths for multimedia requests.
    • The invention can be implemented using software or embedded sequential logic, with the flexibility to adapt to different network conditions and requirements.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a content synchronization framework for connected devices, incorporating related applications filed concurrently.
* The invention addresses limitations of existing data synchronization methods, such as lack of support for dynamic attributes, arbitrary attribute-based prioritization, logical bundling of data, and resumption after disruptions.
* The invention introduces a central reference point that processes synchronization requests, prioritizes file downloads, and returns file bundles to client devices.
* The framework allows for contextual synchronization based on dynamic attributes, supports multiple languages and character sets, and is scalable due to client device processing.
* The invention employs data compression and concurrent priority-based downloading to optimize bandwidth usage.
* The synchronization process involves client devices sharing contextual information, central reference point compiling response bundles, and client devices downloading and updating files based on the response bundles.
* The invention supports synchronization resumption from the last successful download bundle in case of connection disruptions.
* The invention allows for the creation of delta lists by client devices to determine files to download, and supports scripted handling of downloaded files.
* The invention can cache responses for similar client requests to improve scalability and response times.
* The invention can be deployed worldwide and supports both synchronous and asynchronous interactions.
* The invention is adaptive, allowing for reordering of downloads in case of failures and optimizing download order based on factors like communication speed and geographical proximity.
* The invention is illustrated with diagrams and flowcharts showing the synchronization framework and processes.
* The invention is related to a smart phonebook search application and a smart content information merge and presentation application.
* The invention is protected by U.S. Provisional Patent Application Ser. No. 61/319,999, filed on Jun. 21, 2006, and assigned to M/s. S. R. Dhawan & Co.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to methods and systems for allowing anonymous communication between a finder of a lost object and its owner.
    * It provides a unique ID to the owner for registering the object and associating it with contact information and a virtual locale.
    * The finder can communicate with the owner through the virtual locale without revealing their identity.
* The invention includes a system with a centralized database, a virtual locale, and a module for forwarding finder communications to the owner.
    * The owner can register tag IDs and contact information on the database.
    * The finder can access the database to view open cases and communicate with the owner using the unique ID and virtual locale.
* The invention overcomes the disadvantages of prior systems by providing timely and anonymous communication.
    * It eliminates the need for a third party intermediary and ensures the privacy of the owner's contact information.
* The invention can be implemented using various programming languages, operating systems, and database systems.
    * The Apache open source web server software and the MySQL open source relational database running under the Linux operating system are examples of adaptable technologies.
    * The Perl module Net-Oscar is available for interfacing with instant messaging systems.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to electron multipliers, particularly foil electron multipliers, used in photomultipliers and particle detectors.
* * The invention improves upon conventional electron multipliers by using a series of thin foils to create and transmit secondary electrons, resulting in higher gain efficiency.
* * Foil electron multipliers are simpler and less costly to fabricate than continuous multipliers like microchannel plates (MCPs).
* * The invention allows for larger area coverage and intrinsic rejection of ion feedback, which is a limitation in continuous multipliers.
* * The invention can be used in various applications, including electron spectrometers, mass spectrometers, and photonic detectors.
* * The invention comprises a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure, with an applied voltage to accelerate electrons and generate a growing avalanche of electrons.
* * The foil electron multiplier's gain is maximized by optimizing electron transmission, secondary electron emission yield, and foil thickness.
* * The invention does not experience ion feedback, as generated ions are accelerated toward the previous stage and cannot initiate another avalanche.
* * The invention uses commercially available foils, such as carbon, with a range of thicknesses and dimensions.
* * The invention was demonstrated using a series of foil stages and anode, with a measured gain as a function of applied voltage per stage.
* * The invention has a higher gain per stage than conventional electron multipliers, resulting in fewer required stages.
* * The invention is intended to be defined by the claims appended hereto, with many possible modifications and variations.
* * The invention's principles and applications are explained to enable skilled individuals to utilize the invention in various embodiments.
</summary>

<summary>
* Technologies Utilized in the Invention
  * Substances that Change Color and Transparency
    * Objects that change color have been known for a long time.
    * Technologies include photochromatic lenses, thermochromatic materials, LEDs, phosphors, liquid crystals, and polaroids.
  * Digital Photo Sensors
    * Digital cameras convert light into electrical signals.
    * They consist of an array of pixels that measure light and convert it into a digital image.
* Miniature Special Purpose Computers
  * Computers have advanced in miniaturization for specialized functions.
  * They can process digital images to detect motion and control lens states.
* Algorithms to Detect Movement in Motion Pictures
  * Edge-based algorithms detect changes in pixel values to identify motion.
  * The preferred embodiment uses an intensity edge map algorithm for synchronization events.
* Detailed Description of the Figures
  * FIG. 1 illustrates the 3-D Phenomenoscope with a preferred lens state configuration.
  * FIG. 2 shows the use of the 3-D Phenomenoscope to view a motion picture with a 3-dimensional effect.
  * FIG. 3 shows the three lens states used by the 3-D Phenomenoscope.
  * FIG. 4 depicts the Glass Lens Controller Unit (GLCU) of the 3-D Phenomenoscope.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a field emission display device with a protection structure to prevent damage to field emission components.
* The protection structure includes at least one reduction plate or electrode on the cathode.
* The reduction plate is typically made of conductive metal and is electrically connected to a bias voltage source.
* The reduction plate alters the discharge path of ionized gases, preventing electrical surges to the cathode.
* The reduction plates can be elongated and run parallel to rows of field emission elements or arranged in a meshwork- or net-shaped configuration.
* The invention aims to prolong the lifetime of the field emission elements and improve the device's performance.
* The manufacturing process involves depositing metal layers, patterning with photolithography, etching, and forming field emission elements and reduction plates on the cathode plate.
* The reduction plates are formed on the same plane as the cathode strips and are alternately spaced-apart or arranged in a meshwork- or net-shaped pattern.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an image sensor with multiple imaging planes.
    * It addresses the limitation of traditional CCD sensors that cannot image two opposing surfaces simultaneously.
    * The sensor includes a semiconductor substrate with P-type material and multiple image sensor elements.
* The substrate has a highly doped bottom layer and a lightly doped upper layer.
    * Image sensor elements are arranged in columns and include a photodiode and a buried-channel CCD.
* P+ layers are formed between the edge surfaces and the image sensor elements.
    * These layers guide charge carriers toward the CCDs located along the edges.
* The sensor can image in multiple planes, including edge surfaces.
    * The doped layers create a waveguide-like structure for charge carrier guidance.
* The invention can be easily incorporated into various types of known image sensors.
    * It offers advantages in applications requiring simultaneous imaging of two opposing surfaces or surface imaging of passageways.
* The invention can also be used for color applications with appropriate filters and optics.
    * The sensor can scan color documents in a single pass.
* The preferred embodiments include specific details on substrate thickness, doping levels, and CCD configurations.
    * Mounting arrangements are provided to avoid interference from external connections.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to home networks with power management systems for devices.
    • Power management is needed due to high energy consumption of network appliances.
    • Current systems struggle to enter power save mode while performing network administrative functions.
• The invention proposes methods for transferring network administrative functions from master to slave devices.
    • This transfer can occur when a master device is instructed to enter power save mode.
    • The master device sends data to a slave device, enabling it to take over administrative functions.
• The invention also allows for the selection of the best qualified slave device to become the new master.
    • Selection criteria include device visibility, intelligence/functional capabilities, and user selection.
• The invention ensures network administration continues while minimizing power consumption.
    • Devices can automatically become master nodes if no beacons are found on the network.
    • The invention can be modified without departing from its scope.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to antenna arrangements for measuring the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation.
    • It addresses the challenge of measuring low elevation angles due to ground reflections.
    • The invention extends the concept of an equi-spaced triplet of antenna elements to optimize angle measurements.

• The invention comprises an antenna array with at least four antennae, arranged in at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane.
    • Each triplet is characterized by the spacing of its elements and the height of the center element above the ground plane.
    • The array can operate in receive or transmit mode, with signal processing circuits for angle measurement or coded transmission for angle determination.

• The invention uses a combination of vectorial combination and division of derived signals to provide a quotient signal that is a function of the elevation angle but independent of the ground reflection coefficient.
    • A common coherent carrier is required for transmissions from each element of a triplet to achieve interferometric performance.
    • The invention can provide unambiguous angle measurements and high measurement accuracy over a range of elevation angles.

• The invention can be used for applications such as monitoring aircraft height during landing approaches and coding angles in space for remote angle determination.
    • The invention can be integrated with secondary surveillance radar systems to associate angles with specific aircraft.
    • The invention can also provide high directivity for setting upper coverage limits in radar systems.

• The invention aims to optimize measurement sensitivity and resolution, particularly for low elevation angles.
    • The invention uses a set of triplets with different spacings and heights to cover a range of angles with unambiguous measurements.
    • The invention allows for a weighted average of measurements from multiple triplets to determine the optimum result.

• The invention can be implemented with superheterodyne receivers and dynamic range considerations for signal processing.
    • The invention can minimize multi-path interference effects by sampling signals quickly after arrival.
    • The invention can select the most appropriate triplet for further processing based on the desired elevation angle coverage.

• The invention can be used for civil and military

<summary>
• The invention relates to high intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamps, subminiature lamps, lamp assemblies, and a lamp system.
    • It addresses issues with traditional adhesive-based seals in subminiature lamps.
    • The invention utilizes a high temperature polymer to directly surround and support the glass envelope.
    • A fluoroelastomer is preferred for its heat resistance, chemical resistance, and ease of handling.
• The polymeric seal support forms a liquid tight seal around the glass envelope and the lamp base.
    • The polymeric seal support can be custom-fitted to the lamp and base, providing extended axial length sealing.
• The polymeric seal support is non-thermally conducting and can withstand significant subminiature lamp temperatures.
    • It offers resistance to invasion and chemical attack, maintaining integrity during operation and sterilization.
• The invention eliminates the need for adhesive or cement, reducing uneven adhesive application and improving lamp centering.
    • The polymeric seal support allows for a single sealing surface, reducing degradation from compression forces.
    • The invention minimizes the number of sealing points and maximizes seal surface length, reducing the risk of early failure due to air and fluid ingress.
• The invention can be applied to any situation requiring insulation, heat degradation resistance, solvent and chemical resistance, and effective sealing.
    • The invention includes various forms of seals to prevent liquid and gas ingress into the lamp assembly.
    • The invention can be adapted with changes and modifications without departing from its core principles.
• The invention includes illustrative embodiments, but the scope of the invention extends to all reasonable changes and modifications.
    • The invention is protected by patent warranty.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a technique for configuring a Generalized Decision Feedback Equalizer (GDFE) based precoder in multi-user MIMO systems, which reduces computational cost without capacity loss.
        • The technique relaxes the requirement for knowledge of the covariance matrix corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise," a key component in conventional GDFE Precoder design.
        • The proposed method does not require channel reduction when the Input Covariance Matrix for the downlink channel is rank deficient.
        • The invention achieves significant improvement in computational cost over conventional GDFE Precoders.
        • The GDFE Precoder includes a feedforward path, a feedback path, and an interference pre-cancellation block.
        • The interference pre-cancellation matrix G is determined by computing a filter matrix C using one of a plurality of alternative formulas.
        • The proposed method is suitable for improving the performance of various MU-MIMO wireless systems, including future "4G" cellular networks.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and housing, enhancing heat dissipation efficiency without altering assembling conditions.
    • The housing features an extended sidewall for increased air intake area.
       • The sidewall extends radially outwardly in a symmetrical, frustum-conical, or frustum-elliptical manner.
       • An inclined portion or beveled edge can be formed around the air inlet or outlet.
    • The housing design allows for enlarged impeller dimensions, increasing airflow and efficiency.
       • The impeller blade dimension increases with the outward extension of the housing sidewall.
    • The housing includes a passage with a gradually reduced inner diameter, concentrating airflow to the heat sink's hottest area.
       • The design guides air streams toward the heat sink's central hotter region for effective cooling.
    • The device can be mounted within a system casing housing electrical elements.
       • The device is positioned close to heat sources for optimal cooling.
       • The design can be utilized with a heat sink to further enhance heat dissipation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel that can display different colors based on the situation without using an intermediate electrode.
    * The display panel is composed of various layers laminated on a glass substrate, including electrode layers, insulation layers, and luminescent layers.
        * The first luminescent layer emits light without visible red components, while the second luminescent layer emits light with visible red components.
        * The display panel can switch between green light display at night and lemon light display at day by changing the voltage level.
        * The display panel can also be modified to display different colors by using color filters or changing the luminescent layer materials.
* The display panel can be manufactured in a simple structure and at a low cost.
    * The manufacturing process involves forming various layers on the glass substrate, heat-treating the layers, and forming the second electrodes.
        * The display panel can be modified in various ways, such as changing the luminescent center materials or using different color filters.
        * The display panel can be shaped in certain patterns to realize a pattern display.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to an electronic portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, which increases flexibility and reduces the need for specialized equipment.
        • The terminal uses a network or the Internet for transferring digitized speech, sounds, music, etc., and can establish a wireless connection to a connecting unit.
            • The terminal can independently control and communicate data packets according to a standardized Internet/network protocol like TCP/IP.
            • It can dynamically allocate a useful IP address via the protocol means, facilitating greater mobility.
    • The invention also relates to a system and a method for Internet/network telephony, which allows for centralized handling of connections and additional functionalities like news, reading of mails, and chat rooms.
        • The system comprises a portable communications terminal, a connecting unit, and a service server connected to the Internet/network.
            • The service server can keep track of user availability and provide additional services based on user profiles.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention addresses the integration of high-dielectric oxides in semiconductor circuitry, overcoming issues with reactivity and low dielectric constant layers formed at interfaces.
        • A Ge buffer layer on Si or GaAs substrates is proposed to enhance epitaxial growth and prevent Pb/Bi diffusion.
            • Germanium, less reactive with Si and GaAs, allows for epitaxial growth of high dielectric oxides and serves as a diffusion barrier.
            • A second ferroelectric buffer layer, such as SrTiO3, can be used to stabilize Pb/Bi-containing ferroelectrics and improve their properties.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces a receiver input circuit with multiple amplification control circuits to minimize distortions and maintain signal integrity.
  * The first control circuit prevents overloading of the mixer and varactor diodes by controlling the band width and signal response threshold.
  * The second control circuit avoids overloading of the mixer stage and protects against frequency influences from strong signals.
  * The third control circuit, with a lower response threshold and band width, can be adjusted to reduce the signal response threshold for stronger spurious signals, enhancing protection of the input circuit.
* The invention employs PIN diodes for amplification control, which do not introduce distortions and allow for constant operating power during control.
  * The control circuits are designed to avoid signal distortions and interference, with the possibility of buffer amplifiers to isolate rectifier circuits from distortions.
  * The control signal can be leveled by capacitors to quickly respond to peak amplitudes and minimize interference.
* The invention includes an extended tunable selective circuit with a separate tuning voltage supply, allowing for iteration-free alignment of tuning circuits.
  * The invention also features a common tuning of a two-circuit filter with a twin varactor diode, providing high selectivity and identity of the C (U) characteristic of the varactor diodes.
* The invention's input network can be tuned by varactor diodes, with the advantage of a greater control range and selectivity compared to previous embodiments.
  * The invention's control circuits are integrated with the input network, ensuring no substantial temperature changes during control.
  * The invention's control circuits protect against high-voltage discharge surges from the antenna.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system for initiating a collaborative work-share environment between two or more parties over a telephone call without complex setup processes.
    * The system includes a telephone and a desktop PC connected to a LAN, with a collaboration indicator and button on the telephone.
    * The system uses network-enabled applications on the PCs to allow information sharing and video conferencing while maintaining voice communication.
    * The system can be implemented using IP-based PBX systems, PCs, and multimedia terminals with network access.
    * The system can be implemented in a peer-to-peer or client-server architecture, and can be integrated into a single computer with voice capability provided by a microphone input.
    * The system can be implemented over a data network or dedicated telephone networks, and can be implemented using various carrier media.
* The system includes a call setup process that establishes voice paths between the parties and determines if they can collaborate.
    * The call setup process involves sending dialed digits, establishing duplex voice paths, and exchanging IP addresses.
    * The call setup process also involves initializing the collaboration indicator based on the availability of common collaboration applications.
    * The call setup process can be implemented using a call control unit that manages the call state and communicates with the collaboration control programs on the PCs.
* The system includes a tear-down process that extinguishes the collaboration indicator when a party hangs up or the call ends.
    * The tear-down process involves receiving a hang-up event from the party and notifying the collaboration control program to extinguish the indicator.
    * The tear-down process can also involve determining if any remaining parties can collaborate and keeping the indicator illuminated accordingly.
    * The system can also indicate FAX capability and support FAX collaboration in addition to voice and video conferencing.
* The system can be implemented using various network configurations and hardware components.
    * The system can use separate connections from the telephone to the LAN and from the PC to the LAN, or use a "one wire to the desktop" configuration.
    * The system can use a server PC or a peer-to-peer architecture, and can integrate the telephone equipment within the computer.
    * The

<summary>
* The invention relates to optimizing the visual impact of an advertising clip inserted into a video sequence by ensuring continuity in terms of salience between the video sequence and the advertising clip.
    * The method involves generating salience maps for the video sequence and the advertising clips, determining a degree of similarity between these maps, and selecting the advertising clip with the highest degree of similarity for insertion.
    * The salience maps represent the salience of the video sequence and the advertising clips, with higher values indicating greater interest and attention-attracting properties.
    * The degree of similarity can be determined by calculating the correlation coefficient, Kullback-Leibler divergence, or by comparing the Euclidean distances between the maximum salience points of the video sequence and the advertising clip.
    * The selected advertising clip is inserted at a predefined or manually defined point in the video sequence, preferably at a shot change to minimize disruption to the viewer.
* The invention also relates to a device for processing pictures to insert an advertising clip at a point in a video sequence, comprising means for generating salience maps, determining similarity, selecting the clip, and inserting it into the video sequence.
    * The device can automatically detect shot changes in the video sequence or allow manual selection of the insertion point.
    * The device stores the algorithms for processing in read-only memory and can archive the enhanced video sequence for future use.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a recessed mask structure in semiconductor devices to prevent high electrical fields at intersections, reducing breakdown and leakage current.
        • The mask is positioned below the surface to be planarized, at a location with undisturbed surfaces, to lower electric field concentrations.
            • The preferred position of the mask is about 5 nanometers below the surface.
            • The mask material is typically a hard low k dielectric with a higher k value than the intralevel dielectric.
    • The invention provides a process for creating a recessed mask structure that minimizes high electric field points and allows for controlled capacitance.
        • The process involves selectively removing mask material to achieve a desired thickness and positioning the mask away from high field points.
            • The etching process used can vary, but typically involves a plasma tool with specific gas flow rates and power settings.
    • The invention offers several benefits, including lower capacitance, reduced breakdown risk, and minimized damage to conductive liners during processing.
        • The recessed mask structure can be integrated into a component, providing a lower and predictable overall capacitance for faster signal propagation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces a novel design for an analog-to-digital converter (ADC) that directly samples and downconverts a modulated intermediate frequency (IF) signal to baseband in-phase (I) and quadrature (Q) components.
  * The ADC utilizes predictive coding principles and digital signal processing (DSP) techniques to implement the predictive loop filter, eliminating the need for complex analog discrete-time circuitry.
  * The sampler element, implemented as a 1-bit ADC, converts the loop error signal to a digital representation, which is then used to generate a control signal for the variable gain amplifier (VGA).
  * The predictive filter element, implemented using DSP techniques, generates a prediction of the modulated IF signal at the next sampling epoch and filters out quantization noise, increasing the dynamic range and precision of the digital representation.
  * The offset nuller element dynamically estimates and removes offsets introduced by various circuits, enhancing the DC offset performance of the ADC.
  * The ADC operates in a subharmonic mode, allowing the predictive loop to downconvert the signal and reducing the complexity of the digital logic used in the predictive digital filter.
  * The ADC's dynamic range performance is further extended by using the digital output of the predictive loop to control the gain level applied to the input signal, increasing the overall dynamic range of the converter.
  * The invention's integrated offset nuller dramatically enhances the DC offset performance by eliminating biases introduced by implementation circuit imperfections.
  * The invention's design allows for the use of lower cost and lower power consumption digital hardware, while maintaining high dynamic range and low quantization noise performance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to active solid state devices, specifically sensors with nanodimensional features responsive to molecular compounds, organisms, or gas molecules.
    * The invention utilizes nanoimprint lithography (NIL) to fabricate semiconducting active layers with parallel nanotraces for direct electrical detection in sensing applications.
        * Nanoimprint lithography patterns the active semiconductor layer using a quartz template with pre-defined nanoscale features.
            * The process involves depositing a photoresist layer, exposing it to UV light through the template, and then etching away the residual layer to transfer the nanotrace pattern.
            * The semiconductor nanotraces are patterned with specific dimensions to increase response sensitivity and enable direct electrical transduction of target molecule binding.
            * The method allows for the fabrication of arrays of sensor devices with multiplex detection capabilities.
    * The invention also includes a method for synthesizing anchor probe libraries on the surface of the semiconductor nanotraces using photogenerated reagents (PGR).
        * The PGR method involves partitioning sensor devices into different reaction wells during coupling and using UV light to activate the reagents.
            * The anchor probe molecules are covalently bonded to the surface of the semiconductor nanotraces, making each sensor device uniquely responsive to specific targets.
            * The method enables parallel deposition of different anchor probes onto the sensor devices during a single process.
            * The multiplex detection array can be packaged onto an electronics board for signal acquisition and processing.
* The invention provides a cost-effective, time-efficient, and reproducible method for fabricating arrays of nano-scale features on a single wafer for multiplex detection of selected analytes.
    * The method uses NIL to define groups of semiconducting nanotraces between electrodes, which serve as sensors or multiplex detection zones.
        * Binding of complementary targets to the anchored probe molecules near the semiconducting active layer produces a change in electrical conductivity that can be monitored externally.
            * The method allows for the detection of g

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages, specifically addressing the contamination issue of unplated lead surfaces in conventional packages.
        • The method involves singulating a plurality of semiconductor dies coupled to a common leadframe, exposing the leadframe's side surfaces, and plating these exposed surfaces with a different material than the leads.
        • The plating material can be metallic, such as tin, silver, gold, nickel-gold, nickel-palladium, or nickel-palladium-gold, to prevent oxidation and improve soldering results.
        • The singulation can be performed using full or partial cuts, with the option to use blades of different thicknesses or shapes, including beveled edges, to create steps or beveled surfaces on the semiconductor packages.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a dual mode mobile terminal that can selectively connect to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local area network (WLAN).
    * The WWAN and WLAN are integrated into a Fixed Mobile Convergence (FMC) system, allowing the mobile terminal to switch between the two networks based on signal strength and other criteria.
    * The mobile terminal contains two wireless modules: one for connecting to the WWAN and another for accessing the WLAN and receiving service information from the WLAN.
    * The WLAN access point has a GSM module for scanning the broadcasting information of neighboring base stations and transmitting this information to the mobile terminal.
    * The mobile terminal uses the service information to select a serving base station for connecting to the WWAN, potentially skipping initial scanning procedures and accelerating the connection process.
    * If the mobile terminal fails to connect to the serving base station using the service information, it can scan the frequency channels or perform a full scan of the base stations.
    * The invention allows for seamless switching between WLAN and WWAN, regardless of the mobile terminal's status (e.g., "call set up," "idle," or in a calling status).
* The invention aims to solve issues related to power consumption and connection reliability when a mobile terminal simultaneously connects to both WWAN and WLAN.
    * By using service information from the WLAN access point, the mobile terminal can make more informed decisions about when to switch to the WWAN, reducing the need for scanning and improving connection stability.
    * The invention provides a method for a mobile terminal to select a serving base station in a communication system that includes both WWAN and WLAN, with the WLAN access point gathering and broadcasting service information.
    * The mobile terminal can access the WWAN by selecting a serving base station with the strongest signal strength or a specific mobile phone operator based on the service information.
    * The invention includes a flow diagram illustrating the method for the mobile terminal selecting a serving base station, which involves turning on the WWAN module based on certain rules, receiving service information from the WLAN access point, and selecting a serving base station based on this information.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a new process for manufacturing multilayered electrical components, such as capacitors, coils, and resistors, with significant simplifications and cost reductions.
  * * The process involves creating laminate sub-assemblies by screen printing electrodes and electrical components onto flexible decals.
    * * * The decals are prepared with punched holes for accurate registration upon assembly.
    * * * Electrodes and components are screen printed onto the decals using transfer inks that solidify upon heating.
    * * * The sub-assemblies are stacked in precise relation to form the final assemblies.
  * * * The process eliminates the need for cutting and metallizing, reducing labor and potential defects.
    * * * It allows for the fabrication of smaller parts and lower voltage ratings.
    * * * The process enables the production of parts with any shape, not just parallelepipeds or cylinders.
  * * * In-process inspection is enhanced, allowing for perfection checks before construction.
  * * * The process allows for the use of thinner dielectric materials due to the embedded electrode configuration.
  * * * The process eliminates cutting stress cracks and internal delamination issues.
  * * * The process reduces labor content per part and enables rapid inventory response due to decal storage.
  * * * The process is adaptable to various electronic ceramic devices, including inductors and substrates.
  * * * The process can be used to fabricate precision registers with series connected resistors and coils.
* The invention also includes methods and apparatus for interconnecting electrodes in stacked sub-assemblies and locating sub-assemblies in precise registered relation.
  * * * The process allows for building up stacks with covering components at the upper and lower ends of the stacks.
    * * * The process can be used to fabricate a variety of configurations, including transformers and magnetic amplifiers.
    * * * The process enables the fabrication of precision registers with electrically resistive material as electrodes.
    * * * The process can be used to fabricate semiconductor packages with dual line configurations.
</summary>

<summary>
• Relates to cellular materials for structural applications, specifically hierarchical cellular lattices
    • Invention claims benefit under U.S. Provisional Application No. 61/038,227
    • Supported by U.S. Government, specifically DARPA/ONR
    • Sandwich panels with hollow cores for high specific stiffness and strength
    • Various lattice structures like tetrahedral, pyramidal, octet truss, kagome, and honeycomb
    • Hierarchical lattice structures with multiple cell sizes for improved properties
    • Methods for manufacturing lattice structures, including injection molding and carbonization
    • Applications include transportation, armor, blast mitigation, and thermal management
    • Face sheets can be attached to the lattice structure for various uses
    • Various materials can be used for constructing the lattice structures
    • The invention is not limited to specific embodiments and can be modified or extended
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons using Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) and coal-to-liquid (CTL) technologies.
        • The process includes a wet gasification stage and a dry gasification stage.
            • Wet gasification uses water as a carrier for coal, producing a high-pressure combustion gas with a high H2/CO molar ratio.
            • Dry gasification uses a gas carrier for coal, producing a synthesis gas precursor with a lower H2/CO molar ratio.
        • The process includes enriching a portion of the combustion gas with H2 and generating power from the remaining combustion gas.
            • H2 enrichment can be achieved through water gas shift conversion, and the H2-enriched gas can be used for hydroprocessing or power generation.
            • Power generation can also be achieved by combusting the combustion gas and expanding the hot exhaust gas through a gas turbine.
    • The process includes a Fischer-Tropsch synthesis stage for hydrocarbon production.
            • The synthesis stage operates at a pressure and temperature suitable for hydrocarbon synthesis, typically below 45 bar and between 160° C. and 380° C.
            • The process includes a water gas shift stage to convert CO to CO2 and produce more H2, and a CO2 removal stage to treat the Fischer-Tropsch tail gas.
            • Hydrogen from the Fischer-Tropsch tail gas is recycled to the synthesis stage, and CO2 can be sequestered or used for enhanced oil recovery.
    • The process includes an air separation unit shared by the IGCC and CTL facilities.
            • Sharing the air separation unit reduces the cost of oxygen and improves energy efficiency.
            • The IGCC facility can be sized for power export, while the CTL facility can be optimized for internal power consumption.
            • The integration allows for CO2 capture from the IGCC off-gas, which can be combined with CTL-produced CO2 for sequestration or use in enhanced oil recovery.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces a method for enhancing the surface properties of oxide superconducting materials to ensure long-term stability and reliability.
    * A blocking film is applied to the surface to prevent oxygen loss, maintaining superconductivity at the surface.
        * The film is formed using photo CVD and can be converted to a dense insulating material through heat treatment.
        * Oxygen is precisely controlled in the surface region to maintain ideal oxygen concentration at liquid nitrogen temperatures.
* The invention also allows for the creation of Josephson elements by positioning another superconductor on top of the insulating film.
        * The method is effective for both tablet and thin film oxide superconducting materials, with the potential for epitaxial growth in monocrystalline structures.
        * The process is simple and the resulting Josephson element is highly reliable and stable.
</summary>

<summary>
* One or more seismic motion detectors in an ocean-floor seismometer are suspended as a free-moving pendulum.
    * A spring-loaded plunger restrains the plunger from contacting the ball until activated by a solenoid.
    * The seismometer, once deployed, automatically aligns the detectors with the vertical for proper operation.
* The seismometer can be recovered, and the angle of inclination is determined by measuring the angle between the locked position and a known vertical surface.
    * The invention includes a method and apparatus for automatically leveling seismic motion detectors.
* The invention provides a simple and inexpensive method to determine and preserve the orientation of a seismometer.
    * It ensures good acoustic coupling between the ocean bottom and the detector.
* The invention comprises a mounting and clamp for a seismic motion detector.
    * It levels the detectors and preserves the angle of inclination for later measurement.
* The invention is advantageous for its simplicity, cost-effectiveness, and ability to improve seismic data quality.
    * It is suitable for use in various seismic investigations, including oil and natural gas exploration.
* The invention is applicable to both vertical and horizontal seismic motion detectors.
    * It can be used with existing commercial seismic detectors.
* The invention is designed for deployment on the ocean floor and can be used in deep water exploration.
    * It improves the stability and positioning of the seismometer during descent, ascent, and operation.
* The invention is constructed of materials that transmit seismic vibrations without significant dampening or filtering.
    * It is adaptable to various seismometer designs and configurations.
* The invention can be activated by internal timers, acoustic signals, or other suitable methods.
* The invention is not limited to a specific embodiment and can be modified or improved upon.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention introduces a novel humidity sensing element that is non-hygroscopic, mechanically robust, and provides rapid response times.
        • The element comprises a first electron conductive electrode, a dielectric coating with minute particles of conductive material, a second pervious electrode, and an ion-forming material.
            • The first electrode is made from anodizable metal, the dielectric coating is formed by anodizing the metal, and the particles are deposited in the interstices of the porous dielectric.
            • The second electrode is created by vacuum deposition of metal from a plated filament onto the dielectric coating, and the ion-forming material reduces the dielectric's porosity.
    • The manufacturing process involves anodizing the first electrode, depositing particles in the dielectric, and forming the second electrode through vacuum deposition.
            • The preferred method includes anodizing aluminum, depositing nickel particles, hydrolizing and sealing the anodized layer, and vacuum depositing a second nickel layer.
            • The sensor operates by varying impedance linearly with relative humidity when excited by an alternating current voltage.
            • The sensor is suitable for use in environments with temperatures between 75° F. and 85° F. and relative humidities between 40% and 85%.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a motor assembly with an improved force transmission structure for vehicle window lifts.
    * The force transmission structure features a drive plate with a Y-shaped mounting hole and a shaft with a Y-shaped toothed portion.
      * The drive plate includes a coupling deeper than the body and buffer holes between sections.
      * The shaft has a pinion for driving a gear in a window lift system.
      * The drive plate and shaft are made of materials like plastics and rubber for durability and noise reduction.
* The gear train in the motor assembly includes a worm, worm gear, and damper.
    * The worm and worm gear are meshed, and the damper is fitted between them.
      * The damper has slots for engaging with the drive plate protrusions and is made of rubber.
      * The shaft is held in place by a circlip in the gear assembly.
* The drive plate and shaft are designed to reduce vibration and noise while providing a stable connection.
      * The Y-shaped toothed portion of the shaft fits into the mounting hole of the drive plate, ensuring stable rotation.
      * The buffer holes in the drive plate aid in molding and reduce distortion.
      * The materials used are chosen for their strength, impact resistance, and ability to absorb vibration.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to wireless communication systems, specifically for detecting, identifying, and monitoring multipath signals in WCDMA systems.
	• It aims to improve 3G wireless communication by increasing transmission speeds and adding mobile services.
	• The invention provides a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver.
		• The system includes an antenna, a radio frequency subsystem, and a baseband subsystem.
			• The radio frequency subsystem includes a high frequency oscillator and a low frequency oscillator.
				• The baseband subsystem includes a free running counter coupled to both oscillators.
					• The counter operates in wake and sleep modes, using the high frequency oscillator for mobile time reference generation and the low frequency oscillator for maintenance.
	• The invention can also be viewed as a method of generating a mobile time reference.
		• The method includes providing a high frequency clock, generating a mobile time reference using it, maintaining the reference using a low frequency clock when the high frequency clock is not available, and continuing to generate the reference using the high frequency clock when available.
			• The mobile time reference has an accuracy of approximately 32 nanoseconds.
				• The invention improves the efficiency of detecting, identifying, and monitoring incoming multipath signals.
				• It maintains the mobile time reference during idle mode, allowing for quick transition to active mode and reduced power consumption.
					• The invention includes a WCDMA modem with a free running counter for generating and maintaining the mobile time reference.
					• The modem provides a timing reference for multipath signal recovery and operation of a multipath signal receiver.
					• The invention includes a multipath monitor and multipath radio signal recovery circuit for processing the mobile time reference.
					• The invention provides a wideband spread spectrum multipath signal detector, identification mechanism, and multipath monitoring technique.
					• It monitors signal strength from asynchronous transmitters within a network in the presence of a moving time base and slotted operations.
					• The invention uses matched filtering, low pass filtering,

<summary>
• The invention relates to multiorifice structures and a method of fabrication for use in automotive fuel injector valves.
	• The multiorifice structure is a wafer comprising alternating concentric layers of solid rods and cylindrical members.
		• The rods are angularly disposed with respect to the axis of the structure.
			• The angular displacement of the rods increases with the distance from the center of the structure.
	• The multiorifice structure is made by fusing the layers and then cutting the assembly into thin wafers.
			• The thickness of the wafer is determined by the effective aperture of the interstices.
	• The multiorifice structure has a plurality of triangular shaped orifices, which are more effective in atomization than circular orifices.
			• The triangular apertures provide a directional component to the exiting fluid, enhancing atomization.
	• The fabrication method is simple and economical, involving the twisting of rods and sheathing with cylindrical members.
			• The rods and members can be coated with a lower melting temperature material to facilitate fusion.
			• The multiorifice structure can be made from various materials, not limited to metals.
• The invention offers advantages over prior art multiorifice structures, including increased dispersion capabilities and uniformity of apertures.
	• The angular displacement of the rods allows for a wider spray cone without the need for high pressures.
		• The triangular apertures reduce surface tension forces, promoting better atomization.
		• The fabrication method is more precise and cost-effective than drilling or photoetching.
		• The multiorifice structure can be customized for specific dispersion angles and spray cones.
• The invention is not limited to the specific configuration and method of manufacture described, allowing for various embodiments and materials.
	• Skilled individuals can conceive alternate embodiments with different rod cross-sections or layer arrangements.
		• The invention can be adapted for use in other applications beyond automotive fuel injectors.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method of manufacturing a semiconductor device with an improved LDD structure.
    * The method involves forming an insulating film on the gate electrode and using it as a mask for ion injection and anisotropic etching.
    * The oxide film portion on the gate sidewall, used as a mask for ion injection, can be made of high melting point metal or silicide.
* The method aims to prevent degradation of transconductance and increases of resistances due to hot-carrier injection.
    * The method allows for precise control of the width of the oxide portion on the gate sidewall and the formation of the LDD structure.
* The invention can be applied to both n-channel and p-channel insulated gate (MOS) field effect semiconductor devices.
    * The invention also allows for the reduction of the sheet resistance of the source/drain region by silicidation.
    * The invention can utilize inert gas ions for creating an amorphous source/drain region, facilitating shallow junction formation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved end-user interface for Internet-protocol (IP) telephone communication.
    * It addresses the need for a more convenient, economical, and efficient IP telephone solution compared to conventional systems.
        * The invention introduces an enhanced radio telephone that can operate as both a conventional radio telephone and an improved IP telephone.
            * The enhanced radio telephone includes an internal speech coder for low power consumption, allowing it to be used with lower-performance PCs.
            * It provides a more comfortable handset for users and reduces echo problems common in conventional IP telephones.
    * The invention allows for IP-telephone control from either the PC or the enhanced radio telephone.
        * The enhanced radio telephone can switch between wireless and IP-telephone operation manually or automatically.
            * Users can initiate calls using either the PC software telephony application or the enhanced radio telephone keypad.
    * The invention also enables the enhanced radio telephone to be used for wireless data communication, carrying IP speech.
        * This allows for the use of a standard PC serial port to carry digital speech, control signalling, and IP data.
            * The invention provides a more cost-effective and efficient IP telephony system.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to devices for generating electrical power from surface waves using submerged containers that deform due to pressure changes, enhanced by wave focusing and floating bodies.
    * The invention aims to capture both hydrostatic and hydrokinetic wave energy efficiently.
    * It addresses the high cost and low efficiency of current ocean wave energy converters (OWECs) by using lightweight, flexible containers and adjustable depth deployment.
    * The device can capture energy from both wave and swell kinetic energy, with potential power outputs of 0.25 MW to 1 MW.
    * The invention includes features for increasing stroke and energy capture, such as leveraging connecting means, multi-staged drive cylinders, and surface float connections.
    * It also incorporates wave focusing and reflection techniques to enhance energy capture.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to scraped surface heat exchangers, specifically the mounting of blades onto a central drive shaft.
    • The blades are hingedly connected to the drive shaft and have a scraper edge and a hinge edge.
    • The blades are mounted using at least one pin type connection.
    • The invention includes a blade body with a first side, a second side, a scraper edge, and a hinge edge.
    • The blade body has at least one mounting hole and two L-shaped locking tracks.
    • The locking tracks have entry tracks and intermediate tracks that interfere with the pin to prevent lateral movement.
    • The invention allows for the blades to be installed at an angle, slid onto the pins, and then rotated downwardly until in the operative position.
    • The invention ensures that the blades stay oriented and do not fall off the pins, even in vertical orientation.
    • The invention provides a method for mounting the blades that preserves the structural rigidity of the blade.
    • The invention allows for the blades to be installed with the correct side facing up, ensuring proper orientation.
    • The invention allows for the blades to be removed by sliding them off the pins.
    • The invention uses tracks on both sides of the blades to reduce wear and maintain performance.
    • The invention is not limited to the exact construction and operation illustrated and described.
    • The invention covers all features and advantages within its spirit and scope.
    • The invention is capable of embodiments in addition to those described.
    • The invention can be practiced and carried out in various ways.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention addresses the issue of detecting and eliminating defective and incorrectly positioned cigarettes in cigarette production and packaging machines.
    * An optical checking element, such as a camera, scans images of cigarettes in the magazine to detect deviations from a reference image or value.
    * Image processing evaluates the scanned image, and if a deviation is detected, an error signal is produced.
    * The error signal can trigger an ejecting unit to automatically eject the offending cigarettes.
    * Multiple ejecting units with corresponding zones allow for selective ejection without needing to clear the entire magazine width.
    * The system can also detect other defects like missing filters or bent cigarettes.
    * Error signals can be emitted acoustically or optically to alert the operator.
    * The system can be manually triggered for additional error elimination or sampling.
    * The invention provides a more efficient and reliable method for maintaining production quality.
* The ejecting units are designed to avoid jamming and ensure cigarettes are ejected without obstruction.
    * The system can be integrated with a tobacco recycling circuit for waste reduction.
    * The design allows for both automatic and manual error detection and correction.
    * The invention aims to reduce labor costs and improve the overall efficiency of cigarette production and packaging processes.
* The system can be adapted to various machine configurations and cigarette types.
    * The invention includes a detailed description and drawings to illustrate the apparatus and process.
    * The invention is applicable to both cigarette production and packaging machines.
    * The invention provides a comprehensive solution to the problem of transversely located cigarettes in the magazine.
* The invention offers a significant improvement over manual detection and removal methods.
    * The system reduces the risk of human error and missed disruptions.
    * The system can operate continuously without operator intervention.
    * The system can be customized to specific machine and production requirements.
* The invention has potential applications in other industries where product orientation and placement are critical.
    * The system can be integrated with existing quality control processes.
    * The invention can contribute to improved product quality and

<summary>
* The invention introduces a tool-fixing mechanism with curved connecting surfaces for a wide range of machining applications.
    * The curved surfaces are designed to ensure a secure fit and transmit machining force effectively.
        * The curved surfaces follow a specific geometric relationship to ensure proper fit and force transmission.
        * The mechanism allows for simple tool placement and release, with minimal disturbances during operation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to switching circuitry for driving display drivers with high efficiency and low electromagnetic interference (EMI).
    * It involves modifying switching regulator circuits to create multiple paths that carry current in opposite directions, canceling out radiated noise.
    * Additional terminal lines are provided to sink any EMI generated in the outermost paths.
* The invention enables the production of large amounts of current for large displays without the typical EMI penalties.
    * The reduction in EMI can be increased through the use of terminal leads.
</summary>

<summary>
* Cell Capacity and Energy Content
    * Cell capacity (Ihr max) is calculated using the change in capacity (ΔIhr) and state of charge (ΔSOC).
    * Energy content (ε) of a cell is approximated by integrating the product of voltage (v m) and current (i) over time.
* Cell Voltage Needed for Specified Energy Content
    * Desired cell voltage for a given energy content is determined by considering the minimum and maximum Amp-hr capacity cells and their corresponding voltages.
    * A method to find the target voltage involves calculating the required cell voltage using the minimum Amp-hr cell and comparing the calculated energy with the required trip energy.
</summary>

<summary>
* Battery Pack Charge Time and Balancing
    * Charge time depends on the cell requiring the greatest change in capacity (ΔIhr max), the method of balancing cells, and the portion of the charge cycle selected for balancing.
    * The charge time (t c) is calculated based on the maximum ΔIhr and the charge current rate (i chg).
    * Balancing may occur during charge by shunting current through resistors or at the end of charge by discharging and recharging cells to the same voltage.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention is an AC-to-DC converter for lamp power supply that eliminates low and high frequency flicker light, reducing eye fatigue and protecting health.
        • It includes various circuits for input protection, EMI filtering, rectification, voltage conversion, and output filtering, with adjustable connections and components.
        • The invention can be implemented using different topologies and controllers, and is suitable for various applications beyond lamp power supply.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a system for automatic control of lighting levels in a space, using both electric lighting and window treatments to maintain a desired illumination profile and minimize sun glare.
    • The system divides the space into zones and uses sensors to measure illumination levels.
    • It employs a control system that adjusts electric lighting and window treatments based on these measurements.
    • The system can maintain multiple lighting profiles throughout the day.
    • It uses a single signal from a sensor or group of sensors for control, eliminating the need for separate sensing in each zone.
    • The system can automatically recalibrate based on occupant input, improving comfort and energy savings.
    • It reduces the need for exterior sensors and complex data gathering, lowering system costs.
    • It allows for near optimal illumination control without sacrificing energy savings.
    • The system can be implemented using open loop or closed loop control for electric lights and window treatments.
    • It includes methods for maintaining illumination profiles and reducing sun glare throughout the day.
    • The system can be manually overridden for immediate control.
    • It includes an astronomical time clock for scheduling events based on sunrise and sunset times.
    • The system can be programmed with various presets for different lighting conditions.
    • The system can adjust the window treatments to prevent glare at low sun angles.
    • It uses a dead-band control for window treatments, allowing for a set number of fixed positions.
</summary>

<summary>
* *
    * TSA has implemented congressional mandates and explored options for increasing the use of technology and information to control access to secure areas of airports and to improve passenger screening.
        * TSA is investigating the establishment of a Transportation Workers Identification Card (TWIC) program to establish a uniform, nationwide standard for the secure identification of workers who require access to secure areas at airports and other transportation facilities.
* * FAA has focused its efforts on enhancing the security of the nation’s air traffic control systems and facilities.
        * FAA has established an information systems security management structure under its Chief Information Officer, which has developed an information systems security strategy, security architecture, security policies and directives, and a security awareness training campaign.
* * TSA has implemented congressional mandates and explored options for increasing the use of technology and information to control access to secure areas of airports and to improve passenger screening.
        * TSA is investigating the establishment of a Transportation Workers Identification Card (TWIC) program to establish a uniform, nationwide standard for the secure identification of workers who require access to secure areas at airports and other transportation facilities.
* * TSA has made substantial progress in expanding the Federal Air Marshal Service.
        * TSA experienced some difficulties in meeting the aviation security deadlines and goals, such as operational and management control problems and delays in deploying explosives detection systems.
* * TSA has taken major steps to increase aviation security, including meeting over 30 deadlines in 2002 and deploying federal passenger screeners at 429 commercial airports.
        * TSA has implemented a comprehensive plan for air cargo security that incorporates a risk management approach, includes a list of security priorities, and sets deadlines for completing actions.
* * TSA has begun to develop initiatives that could enable it to use its passenger screening resources more efficiently, such as a registered traveler program that would prescreen low-risk travelers.
        * TSA has requested funding for fiscal year 2004 to begin developing a registered traveler program that would prescreen low-risk travelers.
* * TSA has taken limited action to improve general aviation security, leaving it far more open and potentially vulnerable

<summary>
* LDA and IRC lobbying definitions differ in scope and coverage.
    * LDA does not cover grassroots lobbying, while IRC definitions do.
    * LDA focuses solely on federal lobbying, whereas IRC definitions include state and local lobbying.
    * LDA covers a broader range of federal officials for nonlegislative matters compared to IRC definitions.
* The definitions of lobbying contacts differ among the three definitions.
    * LDA includes contacts with federal officials on any subject matter, while IRC definitions are more limited.
    * IRC section 162(e) covers executive branch officials for nonlegislative matters, but LDA covers more officials for both legislative and nonlegislative matters.
* The definitions of lobbying expenses differ among the three definitions.
    * LDA requires reporting of all lobbying expenses, while IRC definitions only require reporting of expenses related to lobbying covered by the definition.
    * IRC section 4911 has exceptions that can exclude significant lobbying expenses from coverage.
    * IRC section 162(e) has exceptions that can exclude expenses related to influencing legislation and executive branch officials on nonlegislative matters.
* The impact of differences in definitions on registration and reporting under LDA.
    * Organizations using IRC definitions may not register under LDA due to lower reported lobbying expenses.
    * The choice of definition can affect the information reported on lobbying reports.
    * Organizations can switch between definitions from year to year, potentially affecting the comparability of reported data.
* Options for addressing the differences among the definitions.
    * Harmonizing the definitions could align registrations and reporting but may require significant changes to existing policies.
    * Eliminating the authorization for using IRC definitions for LDA purposes could ensure consistent reporting but increase burden for organizations currently using IRC definitions.
    * Requiring organizations to report only federal lobbying expenses when using IRC definitions could improve comparability but still leave differences due to varying definitions.
* Conclusion
    * Allowing organizations to use IRC definitions for LDA reporting may not be consistent with LDA's purpose of public disclosure.
